story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 2 new photos.
message:
IIT Kharagpur welcomes two new deans, Prof. Manoj Tiwari as the new Dean for Planning & Coordination and Prof. Baidurya Bhattacharya as the Dean for Alumni Affairs and International Relations.
Prof. Tiwari, a professor at the department of Industrial and Systems Engineering joined the institute in 2007 and have brought laurels to the institute with his extraordinary research, being rated 2nd among many researchers working in Logistics and Supply Chain Management in India and has many other achievements in his kitty that sets him apart.
Prof. Bhattacharya, who joined the Civil Engineering Department of the institute in 2006, is an associate faculty at the Centre for Theoretical Studies and was serving as the Associate Dean for Alumni Affairs and International Relations.
IIT Kharagpur is extremely grateful to Prof. Biswajit Mohanty and Prof. Siddhartha Mukhopadhyay, whose relentless services as former Dean P & C and Dean AA & IR helped the institute take long strides towards excellence.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes the newly appointed deans, who assume office this semester onwards, a bright and fruitful tenure.

story: Debating Society,IIT  Kharagpur is with Vignesh Viswanathan and 3 others.
message:
Debating Society, IIT Kharagpur congratulates its contingent to the Inter IIT Social and Cultural Meet for their gold-winning performance.
The Parliamentary debate had Vishal Chauhan, Partha Kadambi and Gyan Darshan as debaters, and Tanay Jagani, Aradhana Kumar and Vignesh Viswanathan as adjudicators and we secured gold in the event this year as well retaining our title as defending champions.
The Turncoat event had Rohit Sar and Chandar Siddarth participating and we bagged a gold in this event as well.
Congratulations to all of them!!

Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur in association with Technology Robotix Society presents you 'Fortress'. A nuclear war just affected our planet. And the robots are now trying to save the remaining humans in a habitable environment by building an impenetrable fortress. In order to do this, they have to collect all the suitable blocks in the proper order in a given time before they lose any more lives.

Prizes Worth INR 45,000
For more information go to : https://www.robotix.in/ev...
Register at www.ktj.in/event
#KTJ2k18

Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur in association with Technology Robotix Society presents you 'Poles Apart'. The engineers are trying to design a vehicle that is capable of adapting itself to the rough terrain it is sent into. You are asked to design the prototype of such a bot that is capable of changing the distance between its wheels so as to cover a ground that cannot be done otherwise. There are multiple valleys that converge, diverge or are in an arc form and are to be crossed.
Your challenge is to design a bot robust enough to adapt itself according to the valleys it faces. There are also certain parts of the path that you need to complete before you can cover the further ground. Use a mechanical gripper to complete this problem statement.

Prizes Worth INR 45,000
For more information go to: www.robotix.in/event/pole...
Register at www.ktj.in/event
#KTJ2k18

Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur in association with Technology Robotix Society presents you 'STAX'.
Consider the situation of a factory where heavy machine parts are kept in a random manner and need to be kept correctly for assembling. An autonomous robot will not only make the job easy but also optimize the number of movements.

Prizes Worth INR 45,000
For more information go to : www.robotix.in/event/stax...
Register at www.ktj.in/event
#KTJ2k18

With the help of Metakgp, Technology Students’ Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur has introduced the ‘my KGP’ portal which can be efficiently used to explore the events in the campus, various courses offered by the institute, past year papers, emergency contact details and many more. Visit the portal at www.mykgp.com

Inter IIT Cultural Meet

The 2nd Inter IIT Cultural Meet was held at IIT Kanpur from 28th to 30th December. It was filled with various brilliant performances and IIT Kharagpur gained a remarkable 3rd position. The spectacular performance displayed by our teams throughout the Cultural Meet was appreciable.
Our teams lifted the Literary and Quiz cup as well as the Music Cup.

Here are the final standings of the Cultural Meet:
Gold: IIT Delhi
Silver: IIT Bombay
Bronze: IIT Kharagpur

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning IITs and applauds the exquisite performance of our contingent who performed extremely well throughout the meet. We hope for even better performances in the coming years.

message:
Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur recently organised the first ever edition of its Lean Startup Drive in the startup city of India- Bengaluru, in association with Skillenza and Zone Startups/India Adopting lean startup methodologies for an early stage startup is vital, the mantras of developing a Minimum Viable Product(MVP) were given by eminent entrepreneurs like Rohith Veerajappa and Manik Choudhary. IIT Kharagpur and Tata Medical Center have signed a MoU through which they will soon enter into an institutional collaboration in education, research and outreach programmes in the field of interdisciplinary medical research and technology. The primary objective is to promote collaborative research projects. Through MoU, it is planned to offer joint programs that will eventually lead to master's degree programs. The integrated M.Sc. - PhD is likely to focus in its first phase on medical physics, nuclear medicine and molecular medical microbiology. This would involve students spending at least one semester in each institute with joint supervision by faculty and scientists of both institutions. The degree will be awarded by IIT Kharagpur.

Source: https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/kolkata/iit-kharagpur-tata-medical-center-kolkata-to-launch-joint-programs/articleshow/62256250.cms?from=mdr

In a first among the IITs, IIT Kharagpur will soon start certifying food items at its campus for their nutritional value and also check for adulteration.
The Analytical Food Testing (AFT) Laboratory at IIT Kharagpur received the National Accreditation Board for Calibration and Testing Laboratories' (NABL) accreditation this month.The lab has the most sophisticated high-end equipment to check for adulteration and quality, and is at par with any international laboratory, according to Professor Rintu Banerjee, Department of Agricultural and Food Engineering and the in-charge of AFT Laboratory.
This is for the first time that any lab in any of the IITs or NITs has been given this accreditation, which has certified food testing in the laboratory.

Source: https://economictimes.ind...

TL; DR: Do you know if your department has a lift/ramp/handicapped toilet? Help us make this information widely available for your fellow students.

Greetings KGP!
National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF) recently published their yearly rankings for 2017 of educational institutions in India, in which IIT Kharagpur was placed 4th in the overall rankings.

One of the parameters used by NIRF for ranking is 'Facilities for Physically Challenged Students' which asks the following questions:
1. Does your institution have Lifts/Ramps?
2. Does your institution have provision for walking aids, including wheelchairs and transportation from one building to another for handicapped students?
3. Does your institution have specially designed toilets for handicapped students?

We believe this information isn't immediately accessible to the students as well as the administration currently and would like your help gathering it. Please take a minute and help us by editing the relevant Wiki page here:
https://wiki.metakgp.org/...

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur is with Priyanka Bhaskar and 6 others.
message:
| A tale of perseverance and resilience – rising above adversities to defeat the odds |
Do you know how a team of just 6 girls fought hard their way to the title of Runner-up in a highly injury-prone sport? Do you know when was the last time KGP Women’s Basketball team had reached into the finals of Inter IIT Sports Meet? No, you might not be knowing! Let us tell you. It was 2004 and it’s after a gap of 13 years that these girls have repeated the same in style by winning the silver medal with an undefeated run till finals! But this journey has neither been a cakewalk nor they were served it easily on a platter. They upped their ante throughout the tournament and took it to another level when it mattered most.
In a fiercely contested contact sport which has high risks of players getting injured, the standard team size used to be 11 and the captain had requested for at least 10. But it was reduced to 9 since the administration felt that there is no need of those 2 extra players in a sport which didn’t have prospects of winning a medal. The Woes didn’t stop there. Out of 9 girls selected for the tournament, one of the most key players had to leave due to a medical emergency at her home. They lost their hopes for the tournament with their star player not being able to make it to the matches. Count goes to 8. One more player sustained an injury and couldn’t play. Count goes to 7. One player was in beginning stages and lacked in the experience that it takes to play at bigger stages. Effective count goes to 6. How do you play a sports tournament which requires 5 players and is highly injury prone? Justina Mathew, Ravali Madambakam, Silla Spandana, Saloni Kirdak, Swati Rawat and Remee Patel did the unthinkable! These six players played the entire tournament (5 matches) without having much luxury of getting substitutes. Out of these players, another key player had an injury in her thumb, which was later found to be a fragment fracture. But she didn't give up, she still took the risk and played all the matches. How about that for an example of perseverance? “A basketball team is like the five fingers on your hand. If you can get them all together, you have a fist.” And they proved so. They not only played, they also topped their pool and steamrolled opponent to reach all the way to finals with 4 wins out of 5 matches in their campaign. And along with winning hearts, they did manage to break the stereotype of basketball being the sport of only tall people. They did it all with good dribblers and long distance shooters.

In the first match itself, they were pitted against the hosts IIT Madras. Loud cheering, home supporters, taller players and what not! And guess what? They announced their arrival in style by beating the favourite hosts by 18-16. The team that no one was giving a chance to put up a fight has suddenly started looking threatening. As if that was not enough, their second successive win over IIT (ISM) Dhanbad by 15-8 sent a strong caution to the winds that they were here to stay, compete and win; not just to make up for the numbers. They gathered the momentum and their victory chariot didn’t stop there. In Quarter Finals, they comprehensively dribbled past IIT BHU by 23-19, sending shivers down the spine of opponents. It was an all-important Semi-Final clash with IIT Bombay. Stakes were high and odds were unfavourable but they rose to the occasion and delivered a nasty blow to Bombay’s hopes of going into Finals. It was tie neck to neck until the last moment when KGP got two free shots in the last 10 seconds of the match. The captain committed no mistake in firing them and the second one went in giving KGP a lead of one point. Can you believe that? A team which was being seen as the one participating just for formality and were no believers in them getting into knockout stages was into the finals! In the finals, they screamed, they ran ferociously, they dribbled hard, they threw all they had, they put each iota of energy their muscles could but credit to the opponents, they were simply better that day. As our players admitted, IIT Roorkee deserved the gold medal. Though they lost by 25-44, their entire campaign was studded with brilliant moments – the moments they can take pride on! It was nothing less than a roller coaster ride for them where they defied their own expectations and proved the pundits wrong. All the practice, hard work and perseverance bore sweet fruits.
It wasn’t their victory alone. It was also a big win for their coach Mr Soumen Mondal who played a pivotal role in motivating the team and strategizing for each match. He believed in them and always reminded them of their potential of getting a podium finish. As the players said, “Without his strategies, the victory wasn’t possible.” The never-say-die attitude of the team was all he wanted and girls didn’t disappoint him. The captain Remee marshalled her troop well and her leadership was the key to this entire campaign. A huge shout to these amazing girls!
What lies in the future? Most of the current players are graduating out. The team needs enthusiastic and dedicated junior players to fill the boots. As one of the players admitted, even during the practice sessions, participation from juniors was very less. They had a hard time choosing 9 players for the tournament. Participation from girls was utterly disappointing. And if that’s what will keep on going, we don’t stand a chance in rewriting histories in the upcoming Sports Meets. The current players have appealed to the girls to participate in as large numbers as possible. The sports scenario in KGP among girls isn’t in very good shape right now. We needed inspirations to look up to. Now that we have some of them, why to wait? Hit the ground on the very first day of the next semester!

Performance Summary | Inter IIT Sports Meet
The 52nd Inter IIT Sports Meet held at IIT Madras was a sports extravaganza filled with various brilliant performances. The exquisite performance displayed by our team throughout the Sports meet was quite remarkable and appreciable.
Here are the final standings of the Sports Meet:

Overall Standings:
First Position: IIT Bombay (103 points: 60 Men’s, 34 Women’s and 9 March Past)
Second Position: IIT Madras (89.5 points: 46 Men’s, 34 Women’s and 9.5 March Past)
Third Position: IIT Kanpur (77 points: 54 Men’s, 14 Women’s and 9 March Past)

IIT Kharagpur stood at the fifth position in overall tally with 67 points. They stood fourth in the Men’s category with 45 points, sixth in the Women’s category with 13 points and 9 points in the March Past.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning IITs and applauds the efforts of our contingent who performed extremely well throughout the meet.

With Christmas around the corner, Santa has already begun his preparations to make it merrier!
How are you planning to spend this extended weekend?

#MerryChristmas
#SpringFest2018

Inter IIT | Basketball (Men)
KGP bag gold! In what transpired to be a close encounter, the boys held their nerve and managed to beat Bombay by 5 points (56-51). As a result of that win, the basket ball team gets gold!

We congratulate the basketball team for their victory and hope that we get many more chances to do so!

Basketball Men's Final | Inter IIT Sports

IIT Kharagpur created history by beating IIT Bombay in this nail-biting final match by 56-51 (10-11, 15-11, 10-17, 21-12).
At one time in the match, IIT Kharagpur was losing but the team managed to turn the tables and registered an incredible win over IIT Bombay.

With this, IIT Kharagpur gets a Gold in Men's Basketball. Our team put up a marvellous show throughout the entire series. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the team for bagging the Gold Medal.

message: We feel contented to announce that our team got selected to demonstrate a model in the International Semi-Finals of Masterpiece 2017 organised by Living Talent held at Dubai from 13December,2017 to 18 December,2017. Our product Vibronot was shortlisted for the Grand Finale after a tough competition in the semi-finals and was adjudged as one of the best solution for controlling the Parkinson’s Disease.The model made by the team was staged by their representatives Anurag Goyaland Shyama Agrawal. The team got to interact with Mr. RoopamSharma (Top 8 innovators Under 35 in MIT technology review for his invention to replace braille language) and Mr. Mayur Ramgir (International award winning author) who are experts in the field of innovations and entrepreneurship. We applaud the whole team for their hard work inachieving a colossal platform.

Day 7 Summary | Inter IIT Sports Meet
As we wrap up all the updates of live action going on field at Inter IIT Sports Meet today, it was a day filled with high emotions running down veins for IIT Kharagpur with 3 final matches taking place today. There is no gainsaying the fact that efforts by our players were superb but better performances by opponent teams halted their dream run and broke their hearts, jeopardising their quest for gold medal.
Men's Football Finals:
IIT KGP lost to IIT BHU by 0-2 in the finals but they must be proud of what they have managed to achieve in this campaign. Even though they didn't win the final, their and all KGPians' chests will be swelling with pride for the fact that they ended up with silver medal.
Men’s Squash Finals:
IIT KGP lost to IIT Bombay by 0-2 (1-3, 0-3) in the finals but they did manage to give opponents a taste of their own medicine to remind how strong a team they were! Steamrolling teams after teams on their way to finals, this team surely showcased exceptional skills. They didn't leave anything they could have done and ultimately, bagged the silver medal.
Men’s Badminton Finals:
IIT KGP lost to IIT Madras by 1-3. Despite losing the finals, their dream run has been something that will inspire the next generation of badminton players in KGP. Let's take a moment to applaud their efforts. They ultimately bagged the silver medal.
Tennis Women's Third Place Decider:
IIT Kharagpur suffered another loss to IIT Delhi by 0-2 (0-2, 0-2) in the hard fought third place decider match and hence, couldn't get the Bronze medal in their pockets. But not to forget, they put out some memorable showdowns on show in this tournament.
Basketball Men's Semi-final:
IIT Kharagpur beats IIT Kanpur in the thrilling semi-final by 62-44 (11-15, 18-11, 19-5, 14-13). With this, IIT Kharagpur advanced to the final and they will be competing for top honours with the winning team of the other semi-final match (IIT Bombay vs IIT Madras) tomorrow. So, gear up to cheer the team tomorrow.

KGP stands with a total of 6 gold medals, 8 silver medals and 7 bronze medals after seven days of the ongoing sports meet.
Here's the full summary of all the action that unfolded today.

Registrations for Interrobang 2018 are now open!
Please register through this form if you will be needing accommodation at Interrobang 2018. Registration for the QuizFest is Rs. 800 per person. This covers accommodation (2 days + 1 night), breakfast on both days, and the registration fee for all 5 quizzes. (If you won't require accommodation, you can register for the quizzes on the spot). Rooms are limited and will be provided on a first-come, first-served basis.
If you require accommodation for a longer duration, please email us at quizzing@nalsar.ac.in BEFORE filling this form.
Rules, Regulations and Eligibility Criteria:
•Teams should consist of THREE members or less.
•Cross-college teams ARE allowed.
•The quiz is open to students pursuing full-time degrees from institutes that are affiliated to universities or are universities themselves.
•The quizzes are only for those doing their undergraduate degrees (this includes those enrolled in integrated Masters/PhDs) and postgraduate students born after 20th January, 1992.
•It is NOT open for teams from courses run by professional associations such as ICAI, ICSI etc. This list is merely indicative and NOT exhaustive.
•Participants pursuing degrees through distance mode learning are NOT eligible.
•Participants pursuing Diploma courses are NOT eligible.
Identification cards will have to be carried by all participants.

Day 6 Summary | Inter IIT Sports Meet
As we wrap up all the updates of live action going on field at Inter IIT Sports Meet today, it was a mixed day for IIT Kharagpur with some brilliant performances that saw them through to the next rounds and some better performances by opponent teams broke their hearts, jeopardising their campaign.
Football Semi-Finals:
IIT Kharagpur beats IIT Madras in the nail-biting Semi-Final by 1-0.
With the help of solitary goal by Abhinav Mishra, Men's Football team outplayed hosts IIT Madras by 1-0 and advanced to the finals that will be played tomorrow.
Men's Squash team soon followed the suit and advanced to the finals by getting past the challenge of IIT Kanpur by 2-1. Its final will be played tomorrow.
How could Men's Badminton team stay behind? They too joined the party, completing a treble of teams qualifying for finals. Bruising aside the string challenge of IIT Delhi by 3-2, they too qualified for the finals to be played tomorrow.
But everything didn't go KGP's way today. Women's Badminton team suffered a heartbreaking loss to IIT Delhi by 2-1 in quarter finals and hence, losing out to get a spot in semi finals, ending their campaign.
Women's Tennis team encountered something similar and we're outplayed by the team that played better today. A 0-2 defeat handed to them by IIT Bombay meant their elegant journey got over which was studded with some sparkling performances in between.
Women's Basketball team certainly raised the bar and got something to cheer about. Whatever may the score line suggests, they didn't leave anything to turn up the game in their favour. With a score of 25-44, they lost out on the gold medal to IIT Roorkee. This silver, for sure, is no less than gold, for them, for us, for all Kgpians.
Men's Volleyball team took on hosts IIT Madras in quarter finals and were straightway put under pressure by the opponents. They did reply back with winning the next game but couldn't hold thereafter, suffering a 1-3 loss and missing a chance to go to semi finals. For most of the games in this tournament, they had their tails up and that something they would be extremely proud of.
Men's Basketball team was up next, taking on heavyweights IIT BHU in quarter finals. The match swinged like anything, but ended up being on our side. KGP sealed it's spot in Semi-Finals by getting past IIT BHU with a score of 57-55.
Men's Tennis team was last in the fray for today, playing the 3rd place decider match with IIT Delhi. They put each ounce of their energy in the court but we got to admit that opponents player better. With a loss by 0-2 to IIT Delhi, IIT KGP got fourth place in Men's Tennis.
Hence, KGP stands with a total of 6 gold medals, 5 silver medals and 7 bronze medals after six days of the ongoing sports meet. We will be witnessing three final matches tomorrow. So, gear up to cheer the teams tomorrow.
Here's the full summary of all the action that unfolded today.

But not to forget, they dished out some memorable showdowns in this tournament that will be itched in our hearts forever.

If you get a chance to choose your life again, will you do it differently? What is your purpose in life? “Many Dreams Many Lives”, a book written by our alumna Ms Viji Narayanan (Batch of 1991) follows an Indian women in America who’s emotionally charged self journey begs us to ask these same question over and over again. Cultural discord, marriage, relationship issues with in-laws, world view from different societies, mental health everything is covered in this book. The book will be available on Amazon bookstore in all countries from 11th January 2018 as a paperback print and digital download from Kindle.
Ms. Viji Narayanan graduated from the Architecture Department, IIT Kharagpur in 1991, is a software engineer and an emerging author with a love for a good story. She is also a bollywood buff who aspires to make this unique and compelling book into a Bollywood movie one day.
Watch this Book trailer on Youtube to know more about “Many Dreams Many Lives” - https://youtu.be/UXyqPOtC...

The lifecycle of any start-up can be broadly divided into 3 stages:-

Stage 1: Problem-Solution Fit
The objective of this stage is to find a problem worth solving

Stage 2: Product-Market Fit
The objective of this stage is to build something people want and validate your business model

Stage 3: Scale After Product/Market
Here, your main objective is to SCALE.

We often see start-ups in the pursuit of Product-Market Fit without actually achieving Problem-Solution Fit. Adopting Lean startup methodologies is very essential for any early stage startup.
To develop MVP(Minimum Viable Product), Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur, & Zone Start-ups present Lean Start-up Drive.
Learn the mantras of excelling with the best possible output for you. Interact, ask and learn!
Venue: The Thought Factory, Bengaluru
Date & Time: 23rd December 2017 | 10 A.M
Register at: ecell-iitkgp.org/lsd

Greetings on behalf of Nurture.AI. We are pleased to inform you that Nurture.AI will be conducting AI Saturdays in Kharagpur. As we all know, that Artificial Intelligence is the new talk all over the world; why should Kharagpur stay behind! In this exciting initiative, open and free for all AI sessions will be conducted in Kharagpur. This will be conducted in sync with a worldwide audience across the United States, Singapore, and other Indian cities. Each session every Saturday will be divided into 3 parts where we will implement AI algorithms, discuss research papers, online material and have some interesting discussions.

The session will have a preliminary understanding of Python as a must and here are some resources to help you with that:
https://www.dataquest.io/ for a good guided Python introduction explanations and exercises: (Intro to Python available on free plan)

Python refresher + numpy+ matplotlib by Stanford ( https://github.com/kulesh... )

Pandas tutorials(https://bitbucket.org/hrojas/learn-pandas)

We are very glad to be a part of this and hope you too will benefit from this initiative.
The first session will be in January(tentatively on 13th January). All those interested kindly fill the registration form given below. The details regarding the sessions will be shared with the registered students soon. Also, this being a student initiative we request all interested research scholars and seniors to mentor us and help us make it a grand success.

Let us all join this wave of change and be a part of a global community comprising eminent researchers, PhDs, and students.

Sign-Up form:
https://goo.gl/forms/AluX...

For more details, contact:
Subham Rajgaria: 9830331068
Siddharth Singh: 8826219130

Going beyond its academic and research domains, IIT Kharagpur has announced a unique old age health monitoring service called OASIS (Old Age Support Integrated Services) for the elderly. It is an integrated system for the elderly which provides 360-degree solutions to their health problems through fall sensors, heart rate sensors, infrared sensors, motion sensor, radar sensor and pressure sensor. The system is currently being tested in some old age homes and hospices at Varanasi.

The lead researcher and founder of OASIS, Professor Aurobinda Routray, Department of Electrical Engineering, said that OASIS could act as an information system as well as a health monitoring system for the elderly, which would help in looking after the services as well as the product aspects.

Source: http://indiatoday.intoday...

The lifecycle of any start-up can be broadly divided into 3 stages:-
Stage 1: Problem-Solution Fit The objective of this stage is to find a problem worth solving.
Stage 2: Product-Market Fit The objective of this stage is to build something people want and validate your business model.
Stage 3: Scale After Product/Market Fit your objective is to SCALE.
We often see start-ups in the pursuit of Product-Market Fit without actually achieving Problem-Solution Fit. A major chunk of startups do not follow the Lean-startup principle during their growth period.
To solve these, Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur & Zone Start-ups present Lean Start-up Machine Workshop.
Learn the mantras of excelling in each stage with the best possible output for you. Interact, ask and learn!
Venue: The Thought Factory, Bengaluru
Date & Time: 23rd December 2017 | 10 A.M
Register at: www.ecell-iitkgp.org/lsm

Kaushik Sengupta (B.Tech and M.Tech, ECE, IIT Kharagpur, Batch of 2007), currently an assistant professor of Electrical Engineering at Princeton University, has been named the winner of the Bell Labs Prize 2017 by Nokia Bell Labs. He is an alumnus of IIT Kharagpur, was the topper of the Electronics and Electrical Communication Engineering Department and was a recipient of the Prime Minister of India Gold Medal in 2007.

He was named the Bell Labs Prize winner of 2017 for his invention of a radical new transceiver chip technology that could power a truly universal software-defined reconfigurable radio.

He completed his MS in Electrical Engineering from California Institute of Technology in 2008 and obtained his Ph.D. in 2012.

Awaaz, IIT congratulates him on his grand success and wishes best for future endeavours.

story: IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club added 7 new photos.
message:
Over the last semester the Quiz Club has seen a flurry of activities, with numerous meetings in which quizzes from every possible genres were covered. Apart from our regular meetings, the regulars of Quiz Club participated actively in quizzes being held in surrounding cities and secured numerous podium finishes there. Here we present to you a compilation of the achievements of the Quiz Club over the last semester.

Winners, Swedish India Nobel Memorial Quiz, Kolkata Round (team of Amit Kumar Ram, Piyush Kedia and Shreyans Sadangi)
Winners, NSSC Space Quiz at IIT Kharagpur (team of Amit Kumar Ram, Ashutosh Dwivedi, Mayank Roy)

2nd Runner Up, NSSC Space Quiz at IIT Kharagpur (team of Rishabh Madan, Sourav Kundu, Venkatesh Pai)

Winners, Quiz on the Beach, Kolkata Round (team of Abhimanyu Bharade and Piyush Kedia)
Winners, Kharagpur Open (team of team of Abhimanyu Bharade and Piyush Kedia)

We are pleased to announce that the V Edition of Interrobang, NALSAR’s annual college Quiz Festival will be conducted on 20th and 21st January, 2018 at our campus in Shameerpet, Hyderabad. Over the past five years, Interrobang has become one of India’s biggest quiz festivals and this edition promises to deliver the same.

Over the weekend, we have got 5 quizzes lined up for college students with a fantastic prize pool in store. Headlining the event is Major Chandrakant Nair, who will be hosting two quizzes.

This is the line-up and schedule of Interrobang 2018:

20th January, 2018, 10 am: BizSciTech Quiz by Major Chandrakant Nair

20th January, 2018, 2 pm: MELAS Quiz by Jayavardhan Josyula and Siddharth Rajeevan

20th January, 2018, 6 pm: Attorney General Quiz by Balaji Subramanian and Anubhav Sachdeva (this is a written general quiz with a legal element to each question and is designed for non-law students)

21st January, 2018, 10 am: India Quiz by Lokesh Kaza

21st January, 2018, 2 pm: General Quiz by Major Chandrakant Nair

The eligibility criteria for college students can be checked out on our event page at https://www.facebook.com/... .

We shall announce details pertaining to registration and prize money break-up shortly on the event page. We suggest that you book your tickets well in advance and hope to see you attend in great numbers.

See you in Janauary! Any queries may be addressed to quizzing@nalsar.ac.in.

We are proud to inform that Prof.Bhanu Bhusan Khatua, an Associate Professor at the Materials Science Centre, IIT KGP has gained international attention for his work on "Bio-waste onion skin as an innovative nature-driven piezoelectric material with high energy conversion efficiency" in collaboration with POSTECH, South Korea. Their work has been published in 'Nano Energy journal'.

The crux of this innovation lies in their approach to finding new types of energy harvesting materials, which is one of the fields of research Prof. Khatua pursues. Their discovery of the piezoelectric property of naturally occurring and abundantly available onion peels has pushed us one step closer to realizing the dream of renewable energy. Their work documents the ability of these materials to power up small devices such as calculators, watches and mobile LCD screens by generating the required energy from different pressure pulses ranging from our minute heart beat pulses to high frequency sounds.
The generated power from these devices could also light up 30 simultaneously connected LED's in series with each other, with a maximum capability of powering 73 LED's. They have also explored the mechanisms and working principles of these devices. The experiments were carried out practically by attaching the devices to the human chest, table fans and speakers to measure the output voltage.

The numerous potential applications of these devices from healthcare monitoring to robotics have been highlighted much in the academia and paved the way for critical acclamation.
The Scholars' Avenue congratulates the team on this success and wishes the team much more in the future.

For more information, you can read the following articles.
https://www.nanowerk.com/...
https://timesofindia.indi...

For reading the published paper, click the following link.
http://www.sciencedirect....

IIT H - 89/5 (20 overs) lost to IIT KGP - 92/3 (12.2 overs)

Inter IIT | Athletics
The day gets better for team IITKGP. Lokeshwara Rao Reddi and Gaurav Shenoy have grabbed gold and bronze respectively in Men's Triple Jump (Lokeshwara Rao: 13.33m and Gaurav Shenoy: 12.93m).
Meanwhile, Abin Devassia has bagged gold for KGP in Shotput (11.75m).
Hearty congratulations to the winners!

Inter IIT | Women's Basketball
The Scholars' Avenue is glad to report that team IIT Kharagpur won their opening game against IIT Madras in women's basketball.
The game was a close contest with KGP winning by two points in the end (Scoreline reads: 18-16 (2-4, 5-2, 3-6, 10-4)). With this win, KGP is at the top of the table with 3 points.
The Scholars' Avenue congratulates the winners!

IIT Kharagpur team was taking on a formidable team of hosts IIT Madras. After a nail biting finish, IIT Kharagpur bruised aside the opponent's challenge by winning with the score of 18-16 and Justina Mathew (7 points) being the highest scorer!

IIT Kharagpur team was taking on a formidable team of hosts IIT Madras. After a nail biting finish, IIT Kharagpur bruised aside the opponent's challenge by winning with the score of 18-16.

Mail your submissions at submissions@ktj.in before 20th December.

Placement Season | Day 13 & 14
The thirteenth and fourteenth day of Placement Season ended with a total of 57 job offers being offered to the students and there is another 1 job offer in the waiting list category. Companies with most numbers of the job offers on these days were Intas Pharmaceuticals (10), Vedanta Limited (9), Vidyamandir Classes (6), Siemens (4), Bizacuity (4), Balajee Education (4) and many others.
With this, the total number of offers (excluding PPOs) stands at 926 at the end of day 14. Including PPOs, the figure shots up to 1177.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the selected students and wishes all the best to everyone for their placement process!

Kasa Kai Mumbai!

Going forward with our trip to find the next rock sensation, we move to Mumbai to conduct the prelims for Wildfire, India's oldest and largest rock band competition. Wildfire having a cash prize of INR 1,00,000 and prizes worth INR 5,00,000 which includes recording deals, gigs, showcases, scholarships and gifts offers more than what one can can ask for.

We will be waiting for all you rock enthusiasts at True School of Music on 18th December from 5PM onwards.

Interested bands can register at: springfest.in/wildfire

See you there!

Spring Fest, IIT Kharagpur in association with LVDS and Terence Lewis Professional Training Institute is back with its solo dance competition, Shake a Leg.
Send in your online video entries for the preliminary round to dance.sf18@ gmail.com .
Cash prize worth INR 15,000 and scholarships worth 1.5 Lakhs to be won.
Registrations open until 30th December 2017.

Details regarding the video entry:

2. Mail body should contain the name, phone number and college name of the participant.

Inter IIT Sports team of IIT Kharagpur is all set to carve out its own niche in the upcoming 52nd Inter IIT Sports Meet to be held at IIT Madras from 14th December. With the kind of quality performers that this contingent boasts of, the team certainly looks set to break some records and bring laurels to the institution. The team members have already given their sweat and blood in the practice sessions and now, the time has come to show their mettle in the final showdown. The team was off to Madras by train tonight.
Technology Students' Gymkhana President Prof. William Mohanty was present there to see off the team and wish them all the best.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes the entire contingent all the best and hopes for an exciting performance!

message:
3rd Inter IIT Chess Meet | IIT Kharagpur crowned 'Chess Champions'
With the finish of last and seventh round that saw top two teams on points table i.e., IIT Kharagpur (1) and IIT Roorkee (2) clashing with each other to clinch the coveted gold medal, IIT Kharagpur has become the 'Chess Champion' amongst 16 IITs that participated in the tournament. With IIT Kharagpur needing either a win or just a draw against IIT Roorkee to bag the top spot, our players managed to hold the strong opponent team to a draw and thus, winning the trophy.
While Hemanth (White) won his match, Vivek (Black) and Kaustav (Black) drew their matches. However, Prithwi (White) went down to the strongest player of the tournament. With 1 win, 2 draws and 1 loss, the match was drawn with a score of 2.0-2.0. The draw meant IIT Roorkee settled for the silver medal and hosts IIT Madras got the bronze medal.
Throughout the tournament, IIT Kharagpur had maintained its dominance over opponents. Their journey to the title included wins over IIT BHU (4-0), IIT Kanpur (3.5-0.5), IIT Bombay (2.5-1.5), IIT (ISM) Dhanbad (3.5-0.5), IIT Guwahati (3.0-1.0), draw with IIT Roorkee (2.0-2.0) and a solitary loss to IIT Madras (1.5-2.5).
An impressive record of 5 wins, 1 draw and 1 loss is certainly the fruits of the mental toughness and chess acumen of all the players. But what stands out for KGP in this journey is the outstanding performance of Kaustav Chakraborty, a first-year student, who wasn't only adjudged the second best player of the tournament but also was instrumental in KGP winning the crown with 5 wins and 2 draws in his 7 games. Though he lost to Tamhankar Viraj (IIT Roorkee) by just a mere difference of 0.5 points for the title of 'Best player of the tournament', showcasing such strong chess skills at such a big stage and making opponent players bite the dust effortlessly is no mean feat! And the contingent captain Hemanth Kumar Potluri infused the much-needed confidence into the team and marshalled the troop to the glory. Prithwi, Vivek, Saurabh and Gajendra too got into the act and had fun giving opponent players a taste of their own medicine.
Their individual performances were as follow:
Koustav Chakraborty - 6 points (7 games) - 5 Wins, 2 Draws
Vivek Gupta - 5 points (7 games) - 4W, 2D, 1L
Hemanth Kumar Potluri - 4 points (7 games) - 3W, 2D, 2L
Prithwi Sinha - 2.5 points (4 games) - 2W, 1D, 1L
Saurabh Desai - 2.5 points (3 games) - 2W, 1D

This win marks a milestone as far as Chess Culture at IIT Is concerned. It will go a long way in infusing a new life to the interests of chess enthusiasts and work harder to retain the trophy next year. Not to forget, Chess club, IIT Kharagpur has also been quite active regarding the same and the credit for this thumping win goes to all the stakeholders including players, their mentors, officials etc.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the entire Chess team for winning the trophy!

3rd Inter IIT Chess Meet, IIT Madras:
IIT Kharagpur bags Gold!
Our team finished at the top of the table with 11 matchpoints at the end of seven intense rounds. Today's Round 7 match between KGP and Roorkee ended in a draw, following which both finished at 11 matchpoints. However, KGP won the Gold on virtue of higher game-points (Tie-Break 3).
Koustav Chakraborty, a first year undergraduate student, performed brilliantly throughout the tournament and was crucial to the team's victory. He finished as the '2nd Best Player of the Meet', very narrowly missing out from the top spot due to today's enforced draw.
For detailed results, visit: http://chess-results.com/...
IIT KGP Sports heartily congratulates the team of Saurabh Desai, Hemanth Kumar Potluri, Koustav Chakraborty, Prithwi Sinha, Vivek Gupta and Gajendra Kumar on winning the Gold!
#Gold
#MADrush
#3rdInterIITChessMeet

3rd Inter IIT Chess Meet 2017 | Round 6 | KGP close to clinching Gold!
After strengthening its top spot on the points tally at the end of round 5, KGP has given impetus to its claim on Gold medal with a thumping win over a strong team of IIT Guwahati in round 6.
Round 6:
While Koustav (White) and Prithwi (Black) won their matches, Vivek Gupta (White) and Hemanth (Black) drew their matches. With 2 wins and 2 draws, IIT Kharagpur defeated IIT Guwahati by 3.0-1.0.
Round 7: Last round
IIT Kharagpur are taking on IIT Roorkee today in round seven who are the number two team right two. In this clash of titans, if KGP wins or manages to secure a draw, they will be holding the winner's trophy in their hands today evening.
Points Table:
At the end of six rounds, IIT Kharagpur is firmly at the top of the points tally with IIT Roorkee just breathing down its neck. In the table of best players according to points, Kaustav continues to be at number one.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the team for their performance and wishes them best for final round!

Central Library, IIT Kharagpur has become the first library in India to receive the ISO 9001:2015 Certification. The library has got an edge owing to various innovations initiated in the recent past. The National Digital Library of India (NDLI) commissioned by the Ministry of Human Resource and Developed by IIT Kharagpur has democratised the face of education in India. Along with this, the institute also introduced a mobile application in April 2017 for anyone with a smartphone to access the online collection of the library. Recently, the ‘Audio-Visual Lounge’ was also introduced in the Central Library with advanced facilities like video conferencing, conducting presentations, computers with sophisticated touch screen monitors etc.

The Central Library, IIT Kharagpur is one of the largest and finest technical libraries in Asia. It has been catering to the needs of over 10,000 students, 700 faculty members and more than 1,000 staff members.

Source: http://www.millenniumpost...

3rd Inter IIT Chess Meet 2017 | Round 3 and Round 4
After finsihing at the top of the points table at the end of round 2, IIT Kharagpur faced hosts IIT Madras and IIT Bombay in round 3 and round 4 respectively.
Round 3:
IIT Kharagpur took on IIT Madras in third round. While Koustav (White) drew his match, Saurabh Desai (White) won his match. Hemanth (Black) and Vivek (Black) both lost to opponent players having higher ratings. With 1 win, 1 draw and 2 losses, IIT Kharagpur lost to IIT Madras by 1.5-2.5.
Round 4:
It was IIT Kharagpur vs IIT Bombay in round four. Learning from the loss in the previous round, IIT KGP better its performance and made the opponents struggle for points. While Koustav (Black) and Vivek (White) won their respective matches, Hemanth (White) lost his match. But Saurabh Desai's (Black) draw with opponent player of higher rankings ensured that KGP had 2 wins, 1 draw and 1 loss. And hence, IIT Kharagpur got past IIT Bombay by 2.5-1.5.
Round 5:
IIT Kharagpur is competing with IIT (ISM) Dhanbad today in round five.
Points Table:
At the end of four rounds, IIT Kharagpur sits at the number two of the points tally right below IIT Guwahati, and followed by IIT Roorkee at number three. In the table of best players according to points, Kaustav is at number two right now.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the team for their comeback and wishes them best for further rounds!

3rd Inter IIT Chess Meet 2017 | Updates and Results
IIT KGP team has amazed everyone with their stellar performance in the ongoing Inter IIT Chess Meet at IIT Madras. A total of 16 IITs are participating in the same. Each game follows the fomat of 90 minutes plus 30 seconds increment per move from number one. A win fetches 1 point, a draw 0.5 and a loss 0 point.
Round 1:
IIT Kharagpur was pitted against IIT BHU in the opening round. Prithwi Sinha (playing with White pieces) won his match and so did Koustav Chakraborty (Black), Hemanth Kumar Potluri (White) and Vivek Gupta (Black). By virtue of four wins out of four matches, IIT KGP comfortably got past over IIT BHU by 4-0.
Round 2:
It was IIT Kharagpur vs IIT Kanpur in round two. While Koustav (White), Hemanth (Black) and Vivek (White) won their matches, Prithwi (Black) drew his match competing against the opponent player of higher rating. With three wins and one draw, IIT Kharagpur outplayed IIT Kanpur by 3.5-0.5.
Round 3:
IIT Kharagpur is competing with a strong team of IIT Madras today in round three.
Points Table:
IIT Kharagpur sits at the top of the points tally right now after the two rounds, followed by IIT Guwahati and IIT Madras.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the team for their steamrolling performance and wishes them best for further rounds!

The eighth day of Placement Season ended with a total of 70 job offers being offered to the students. Companies with most numbers of job offers on day 8 were Wipro (13), Standard Chartered (13), Capgemini (12), Arc Document Solutions (6), Schneider Electric (5), Exxonmobil (5) and others.
With this, the total number of job offers offered in this ongoing placement session stands at 743 at the end of day 8. And including the number of PPOs (Pre Placement Offers) that many students have already received and accepted, the total number of students placed till now has crossed over 1000. And the number of offers as of now are 1029 (251 PPOs + 778 current). This has been the fastest when it comes to crossing the benchmark of 1000 job offers.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the selected students and applauds the efforts of entire Career Development Centre, IIT Kharagpur team who made all these possible with their untiring efforts.

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 4 new photos.
message:
NSS Camp | Activities and Results
NSS camp for first year UG students was held from 29th November to 5th December at Gopali Panchayat in Poriapara village with the motto of making the village ODF (Open Defecation Free). Around 550 freshers from 15 different units participated in it. Prof. Debashish Roy was the programme coordinator and Dr. Montu Rajak supervised the cooking of food for volunteers. All the students were supposed to dig pits, fill holes on road and to survey the village. Villagers gave a positive response towards the volunteers. Rally was organized by various units to make the villagers aware of the importance of cleanliness and maintaining good hygiene. Each unit was supposed to make five posters and the poster made by Unit-15 was chosen as the best poster, graffiti of which was made on walls of Talbagicha Board Primary School.
First aid and health awareness program were also organized by St. John's Ambulance Bridge, Kharagpur where Dr. Gautum Bankura and Dr. Asim were the chief speakers. They also made the students aware about the importance of mental health. Snake awareness program was also organised by “Yuktivadi Sanskriti Sanstha” in which doubts of students related to snakes were also cleared. Students were supposed to write the diary on daily basis on the activities performed by their respective units. Diaries of Abhishek Jain, Kshitij Agrawal, and Rohan Henry Ekka were chosen as the top diaries.
Nukkads on various topics like women empowerment, drug addiction, cleanliness, dowry were also performed by various units.
The result for nukkad was:
1st place: Unit 12
2nd place: Unit 13
3rd place: Unit 7
Unit 5 managed to achieve the 1st position in physical work.
Overall result was as follow-
1st place: Unit 5 (93.9 points)
2nd place: Unit 12 (91.8 points)
3rd place: Unit 15 and Unit 10 (83.3 points)
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the winning units, appreciates all the good work done by all the NSS units and thanks all the stakeholders who were responsible for organising this camp

story: Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 3 new photos.
message:
A workshop on Product Engineering and IP Commercialisation was conducted by Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur in association with RMoSEE. We saw participation from Prodex, Technology Transfer Group, RGSOIPL and RMoSEE. The speaker, Mr. Kameshwar Eranki, Founder and CEO, VajraSoft Inc.,USA, threw light on the impact of disruptive technologies on future markets and the ease of management of one's Intellectual Property through technological advancements.
Additionally, a hands-on demo was shown to the participants in areas of Reverse Engineering, 3D Printing and Rapid Prototyping.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur had a chance to interact with the CDC chairman Prof. Debasis Deb, the topic of discussion being the ongoing placements. First 6 days of phase 1 of this year's placement saw an astoundingly high number of final year students getting placed. Nevertheless, there are students who could not get any job offer in the initial days and the CDC is apprehensive about the disappointment among such students. Professor Deb said, "There are still a lot of companies lined up in the first phase itself and we shall surely be having a high number of job offers even towards the end of the first phase. So, the students need not lose their spirit and take part in the placement process to show their full potential." When asked about the growing disparity between the number of core sector companies and non-core companies coming for campus placements, he replied, "We tried to call as many core sector companies as possible. But of course, there are several issues, many of them not responding for the first phase of placements. Many more PSUs are lined up after January and the students should not lose hope. Even in the first phase, many core sector companies have come." His message to the students is clear, " Until you come to Nalanda, you can not get the job. So why lose hope? For an instance, 100 students registered for a company, but only 48 turned up in Nalanda for tests (Real Data). We expect more enthusiastic participation since not even half of the placement process is over yet. The companies would be shortlisting more number of students if more people appear for the tests and it increases the probability of more job offers. We are looking after the students with utmost care and hope that they would be giving their best for sure."
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes the students all the best.
#Stay_Calm
#Stay_Strong

Indian Railways has decided to test the two solutions to address a longstanding problem of sleepy drivers given by IIT Kharagpur's Professor Aurobinda Routray and his team of Electrical Engineering department. The two technologies are named 'Walopi' (Warning Loco Pilot) which is a special software which assesses if a driver is falling asleep and 'Chemvist' (Check My Vigilance State') which is a video game for train drivers to check if they are fit to drive. The main objective is to prevent a driver from being assigned duty if he is likely to become drowsy and to alert the operations system including the control centre if he falls asleep while driving.

Source: http://indianexpress.com/...

story: Technology Robotix Society added 8 new photos.
message:
Making a robot is the first step towards mimicking God.

The annual Kolkata workshop concluded on November 5th, 2017, with an excellent note and a great zeal and turn-up from students across many engineering colleges. Technology Robotix Society, IIT Kharagpur, in association with Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur conducted a two-hour seminar in Kolkata to acquaint students from different technical institutes within the city with the problem statements and events that are to be held this year at the grandest Techno-management fest this nation witnesses. Kshitij.

The opening note of this seminar was an airy one, with our beloved Albatross hovering in mid-air over the audience, who enjoyed it a lot. Followed the series of bot demonstrations of the Problem statements for this year’s events. Namely: Poles Apart, the manual event, Stax, the autonomous event and Fortress, the Image Processing event.

The objective of this workshop was to pull out to the limelight the fact that making a robot is not as difficult as people think it is. In fact, there are a lot of possible innovations that one can figure out and make the best out of it if given an opportunity like the robotics events at Kshitij. This was well pointed out by making a few classic and simple robots by the members of Technology Robotix Society. Like a gesture control bot, that is literally controlled by your fingertips. A stair-climbing robot demonstrating the importance of a mechanical design in making a useful bot, and finally a fully autonomous robot that can find it’s way out of a corridor using only sonars.

The workshop ended with the official release of the events that are to be held this year at Kshitij, along with the demonstration of a working prototype for each event. This was done to point out the fact that the events that we have set up for everyone to learn and have fun with are not only feasible but can prove to be a step in a direction that might take you to place, you never thought of.

Referring this workshop to a huge success will not be completely right, if not wrong because the real measure of success will be the participation and the enthusiasm which Kshitij will witness this year. Technology Robotics Society wishes that everyone fulfils our purpose of all the hard work that goes into making these events possible, that is, spreading the culture of robotics far and wide so that what we do can make a substantial impact on the society positively.

Hoping for a great participation and enthusiasm, we wish you good luck!

Amazing work by our alumni so far! We have reached 20% of the target of $60,000 for Student Health and Wellness Program. Visit https://donorbox.org/iitk...

Here's an important notice for all KGPians from the CIC team - "10Gbps internet link is down due to fibre cut, the ISP (Railtel) is working to repair the link. Traffic is now being routed through our 2Gbps backup link and network access is expected to be very slow. Since placement is going on, all users are requested to stop any non-essential internet access until the link is restored to allow placement to go smoothly. We will inform when the link is restored."

Finally, it's day one here signalling the commencement of 15-18 days of this Placement Season. As the Dean (Student Affairs), here's the message of Prof. Somesh Kumar to all the students,
"Dear Students,
You have a lot of expectations from the upcoming placement season starting today. I wish all of you success. However, this placement process is not the end of the world. You may be successful with a high package or low package, or you may not get placed. What is important is to keep trying. This wonderful world has an infinite number of options for life. You have to look for the ones which may be achievable for you. Everyone is not the same and so are the life paths and careers will also not be the same. The important thing is to see what we can do for family, friends, society and the nation. Finally, "Success is not final, failure is not fatal, it is the courage to continue that counts."
Best wishes for happy life to all of you, stay safe, stay healthy, stay happy.

#Stay_Calm
#Stay_Strong

We are happy to announce that Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS is hosting Kharagpur Winter of Code (KWoC) 2017, in association with Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur.
KWoC is a December long online program, open to students from all colleges. For those who already know about Google Summer of Code, KWoC is going to be very helpful for you. Register yourself at http://kwoc.kossiitkgp.in... / as a student and the instructions will follow you.

For those who don't know about such open source programs, KWoC is a platform where you are going to learn about a new style of collaborative software development. Read more on the website.
In simple steps:
- Register yourself.
- Go through the projects.
- Choose one/two you want to work on.
- Contact the mentor of the project.
- Contribute!

We also invite enthusiastic mentors from all places to guide and share their knowledge and help students.
Mentors can register their projects on the official KWoC website http://kwoc.kossiitkgp.in/

A research by Professor Sajal Dhara, Department of Physics, promises to increase manifold the speed and the storage capacity at which future devices work. His team proved that next-generation devices like quantum computers can be designed even without the use of electrons. The artificially created new particle is lighter than the mass of an electron by 0.0001 times which would provide simple solutions to the most intricate problems. The research has been mentioned in acclaimed science journal 'Nature Physics'.

Source: https://timesofindia.indi...

Fresh graduates will be given "rent-free space" for churning out big ideas at the proposed Centre of Innovation in Kolkata. A team of experts, headed by the Director of IIT-Kharagpur Professor Partha Pratim Chakrabarti, would oversee the screening process of the new innovators. Interested graduates will have to submit a short project report. The merit and quality of the report will determine selection. As per the government policy, the IT and Electronics Department will encourage projects that will be good for the common masses. The government’s vision is to improve the living standard of the common man. It will also consider offering scholarships to bright students.

E5, Chronicles of KGP: "The Class Wag"

Here's another contender for Quora's "What's the smartest thing you've ever seen someone do?" :p

E5, Chronicles of KGP: "The Class Wag"

Here's another contender for Quora's "What's the smartest thing you've ever seen someone do?" 😜

As Inter IIT Sports Meet 2019 is going to be hosted by IIT Kharagpur, the Institute has allocated an amount of Rs. 10 crores for upgrading and renovating sports activities to host the same. This is in addition to the annual sports budget of Rs 1.5 crore. Two synthetic courts each for tennis, basketball and volleyball, one synthetic athletics track and an indoor stadium with a food court have been proposed to be built for the same cause which in the long run, would strengthen the sports culture in KGP.
Tennis has also received a major boost with one of our alumni Mr. Vinod Gupta facilitating training program and sports kit upgradation. He has roped in US-based Tennis professional T J Hyman, erstwhile coach of ace Tennis player Leander Paes, to start a training program for Tennis enthusiasts at IIT Kharagpur.

Source: https://timesofindia.indi...

Do you have an idea that can revolutionize mobility? Do you have an idea that can compete with the Hyperloop? If yes, here is your chance to showcase your talents. The French Embassy in India is organizing Easy Ride, a 2-day hackathon on the theme of smart and sustainable mobility. Easy Ride is a prototype and design competition that brings together teams of creative and ingenious students to come with innovative solutions on the theme of Smart and Sustainable Mobility.
All the interested students are supposed to contact Mrs. Alivia Nag(alivia.nag@adm.iitkgp.ernet.in), International Relations Executive of IIT Kharagpur at the Office of International Relations.
Please refer to the following link for more details: https://www.veltechuniv.edu.in/easy-ride/

With our exams just around the corner, it is difficult to ignore the host of stress and anxiety related problems they bring with them. The recent state of affairs in our campus have been very unfortunate, hugely detrimental and in contradiction to an institute with a hallowed reputation. The root of most of the problems though can be traced back to skewed and misaligned perceptions of mental health, followed by some glaring inefficiencies in the systems put in place to keep a check on the same. Our institute's latest partnership with the anonymous online counselling forum, YourDOST, is an effort directed to remove the veil on the former.
In this light, The Scholars' Avenue had a chance to interview one of the co-founders of this organisation - Ms.Richa Singh, also alumni of IIT Guwahati, one of our sister institutes. YourDOST is offering its services to the students of IIT Kharagpur with the institute bearing all the costs. The only requirement from our side is that we sign up with them through our proxy server.

Read on to find out more about the organisation and its journey. Don't miss this chance to check up on your mental health and all the best for the upcoming exams.

https://medium.com/@thescholarsavenue/yourdost-when-we-need-one-the-most-340eabfde3aa

Foundation for the pillars of progress has been laid and cogs are now at places to better the campus life of IIT Kharagpur. A great initiative by the Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur in association with the IITKGP Foundation aims to raise $60,000 (about INR 39L) which will be utilized to induct modern State-Of-The-Art Ambulance into the fleet of existing ambulances in the campus. The surplus, as has been planned, would be utilized in improving the wellness, mental and physical, of the student community within the campus. The initiative has been well received with high hopes by people attached to IIT KGP from all the round the globe.

Awaaz hopes initiatives like these would become harbingers of progress as well as a better campus life at IIT KGP and extends best wishes to both the organizations associated with this initiative.

Visit the link to know more:
https://www.iitkgpfoundat...

story: The Scholars' Avenue shared Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur's post.
message:
The Scholars' Avenue shared Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur's post.

Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur along with IITKGP Foundation have started a great initiative to fulfill our need for a state of the art ambulance through alumni funding. The quoted price for the ambulance is $60,000 and any excess funds will be used to improve the state of facilities in the campus which concern student wellness and health (particularly the mental health).

We urge all our readers to visit the following link to support this cause. The link contains more information on how and where to direct your funds.

Link: https://www.iitkgpfoundat...

story: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur's post.
message:
Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur's post.

In the wake of the recent tragic events that took place in KGP, Students’ Alumni Cell has taken an initiative along with IITKGP Foundation to raise INR 39 L ($60,000) to bring in state-of-the-art ambulance for safe and reliable medical care while en route to facilities in Kolkata. The surplus money raised will be used for student wellness and health on campus (namely mental health services).
"Alumni are an integral part of the institute." True to our notions, they have always been a helping hand to KGP and have contributed significantly to its development over the years, be it the Nalanda Classroom complex or halls' development. It is in tough times like these, the true spirit of KGP emerges forth where the entire KGP family unites as a whole. As it is said in RK Hall, “A Great Place to Learn and Live,” let us make KGP a great place to learn and live.
#for_a_better_kgp
#every_help_counts

A one-person inquiry committee has been set up to clear the air around the unfortunate death that shook the whole institute and left the student community in utter shock. Justice (Retd.) Pratap Kumar Ray, former Acting Chief Justice of Kolkata High Court has consented to be the chairperson of the one-person inquiry committee and will start the inquiry process from 20th November. Any IIT Kharagpur faculty/staff/student/associated person may depose to the chairperson whatever information he or she has about the demise or the conditions leading to the demise. Willing people need to send a mail to Mr. Achintya Kumar Mandal, Joint Registrar (S&P) at achintya@adm.iitkgp.ernet.in about their willingness to depose in a prescribed format (see attached notice) on or before 19th November. Mr. Mandal has been appointed as the Presenting Officer.
You can find the entire notice here: https://drive.google.com/...

Balakalakaar, an event organized AIESEC in IIT Kharagpur, in association with Sparsh, an NGO based in Sakchi, Jamshedpur, was held on Sunday, 12th of November at Gurukul School, Gurabanda, Jharkhand. It was an event which provided an opportunity to the children in the remote rural settlement to express their talents in art, dance, drama, and singing. Another different aspect of this edition was that children just didn't perform, their performances were also based on social evils like child marriage, dowry, gender inequality etc. which still prevail in their villages , and we are sure such an event will create a difference in the mindsets of the people, and motivate them to break free of these traditions.
The event saw the participation of over 70 children and was spectated by their parents and other residents of the village. Shri. Kunal Sarangi, Member of Legislative Assembly, Government of Jharkhand, was the Chief Guest of the event.
On this Children's day, we take this opportunity to present you few glimpses of Balakalakaar 2017.
Because " Smiles are what we live for!"

A team of 4 undergraduates from KGP, Raj Anand, Idal Poorekhorsandi , Anish Moonka and Priyank Sangani have been invited to the finals of ‘Creative Shock’, an International Social Business Competition. Their team ‘Alchemist’ is part of the top 10 teams, chosen from participants from over 102 countries. They have already qualified the first two rounds and have been ranked 9th worldwide. This year’s finals will be held in Vilnius, Lithuania at the ISM University of Management and Economics, from 30th Nov to 3rd Dec 2017.

They are facing tough financial constraints and are looking to raise money for this very cause through crowdsourcing and need help, especially from our esteemed alumni. They currently have raised ₹ 2,400 out of their estimated target of ₹ 3,45,100 with 18 days left to go as of now. This is another call for all those who can help them reach the target so that they may share their idea and implement it successfully.

The link that will follow connects to their fundraising account and also has complete information regarding their initial rounds, including their preliminary presentations and video submission. More information on the team and a breakup of their expenses is also provided. You can check their ideas and their social initiatives by clicking the link. Briefly put, their product aims at tackling unemployment among the low-skilled population. They conceptualized different low-cost and unconventional marketing strategies for targeting the socially aware population.

Link: https://www.ketto.org/fun...

This is wonderful initiative from the students’ side and every donation they receive will take them one step closer to their goal. We urge our readers to have a look at their work and decide for themselves how they can help this team of social entrepreneurs.

For more information on the competition,
you can visit their official page at : http://creativeshock.lt /
or their facebook page at : https://www.facebook.com/...

The Scholar’s Avenue wishes the team all the best and hopes that it can reach its target in time. We hope to see many more of such initiatives in the future and are ready to help in any way possible.

“For us, the biggest motivation is frustration” are the words of Dr. Harish Hande, a Ramon Magsaysay Award (often termed as the Asian Nobel) winner and most importantly, a distinguished alumnus of IIT Kharagpur. An energy engineering graduate (Batch of 1990, Nehru Hall) from our institute, he is a social entrepreneur and the co-founder of SELCO India that has redefined energy sustainability in the country, lighting more than 3,50,000 households at a fairly low cost. In the year 2008, Dr. Hande was chosen by Business Today as one of the "21 young leaders for India’s 21st century" and further in that year, India Today named him one of the 50 pioneers of change in India. But the awards are not the driving force behind his pursuit of excellence, it is the hunger to find solutions which keeps him going. We proudly present to you an article about Dr. Harish Hande in continuation of our web series "Jewels of KGP".
http://awaaziitkgp.org/ha...

KGPians have again proved their mettle at the world stage! A team of 4 KGPians Raj Anand, Anish Moonka, Idal Poorekhorsandi and Priyank Sangani have qualified into the top 10 teams for the finals of 'Creative Shock', a renowned International Social Business Competition 2017 with participants from over 102 countries. This year’s competition final will be held in Vilnius Lithuania, from 30th Nov to 3rd Dec 2017. They all are members of ShARE IIT Kharagpur.
But, due to their tough financial condition, they are not able to finance the expenses of the journey. So, they are seeking support from esteemed alumni. They are trying to raise funds through crowd-sourcing. Any support from anyone, whether monetary or nonmonetary will go long way in helping them achieve their goals. Here's the link to their fundraiser for details.
https://www.ketto.org/fun...
They cleared two preliminary rounds, in which they were ranked 9th worldwide. In the first round, they prepared a detailed business plan to prioritize fund allocation for a social entrepreneur. For reaching an optimal allocation, they analyzed the transaction data and prepared a cost-benefit analysis for the company.
In the second round, they formulated a marketing strategy for promoting products made by physically challenged individuals. The product aims at tackling unemployment among the low-skilled population. They conceptualized different low-cost and unconventional marketing strategies for targeting the socially aware population.

Greetings from Technology Students' Gymkhana!

The Smart India Hackathon (SIH) was a national level effort connecting the higher education campuses. The SIH was primarily a code-fest in which software programmers were challenged to write programmes giving innovative solutions to more than 500 problem statements. The SIH-2017 elicited an enthusiastic response with more than 40,000 students participating. It was concluded in the first week of April 2017 with Hon’ble PM addressing the participants. This is being followed with Smart India Hackathon-2018 which was formally launched details of which can be found in https://innovate.mygov.in... .

The MHRD now proposes to expand the scope of SIH-2018 by including hardware section in it. This platform will provide an opportunity to the innovative minds to showcase their solutions at the national level. It is also proposed that the best entries at the national level would also be provided funding through the Research Parks and the Technology Business Incubators (TBIs) for product development for their eventual commercialisation/extensive social use.

The MHRD expects a good participation in this Hackathon from all the IITs and NITs.
All students are requested to provide ideas (with or without models/prototypes) that will be proposed as problem statements of the Smart India Hackathon 2018. This should be done by mailing the idea totech.gymkhana@gmail.com by 13th November, 2 AM.

You are also requested to go through the 400+ problem statements provided in the aforementioned link and register for the Hackathon. The problem statements are both software and hardware based.

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 4 new photos.
message:
On account of National Education Day 2017 (130th birth anniversary of Maulana Abul Kalam Azad), a workshop was conducted for discussion on “Curriculum: Looking Ahead” in S.N. Bose Auditorium.

Prof. Biswajit Mahanty (Dean P&C), the organizer and coordinator of this workshop, introduced and welcomed the director and other faculties. Following this, the Director, Prof Partha Pratim Chakraborty, started a discussion, and suggestions for the improvement of existing courses and the addition of required new courses were given by student representatives from all groups- UG, PG, Research scholars and the women representative. Thereafter, there was an interaction of students with the Director on the suggestions and complaints regarding existing curriculum.

Prof. Somesh Kumar and Prof. Rajeev Kumar Rawat also added valuable suggestions for the students, as well as for the curriculum revamp. The session concluded with Prof. Prasanta Kumar Das acknowledging everyone for their active participation.

message:
On account of National Educational Day 2017 (130th birth anniversary of Maulana Abul Kalam Azad), a workshop was conducted for discussion on “Curriculum: Looking Ahead” in S.N. auditorium.

Prof. Biswajit Mohanty (Dean P&C), the organizer and coordinator of this workshop, introduced and welcomed the director and other faculties. Following this the Director, Prof P.P.Chakrabarti, started a discussion, and suggestions for the improvement of existing courses and the addition of required new courses was given by student representatives from all groups- UG, PG, Research scholars and the women representative. Thereafter, there was an interaction of students with the Director on the suggestions and complaints regarding existing curriculum.

Prof. Somesh and Prof. Rawat also added valuable suggestions for the students, as well as for the curriculum revamp. The session concluded with Prof. Prashant Kumar Das acknowledging everyone for their active participation.

As they all say, "The pen is mightier than the sword", Business Club, IIT Kharagpur in association with the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) brings to you an outstanding opportunity to showcase your writing talent.
Participate in this essay writing competition with your team of 3-4 members and submit an essay of 2000 words on the topic "Can FinTech revolutionise access to finance in India?' The zonal round will be held in Kolkata on 2nd February, 2018. The winning team stands a chance to win Rs 1,00,000/- and a 3-month internship opportunity in RBI in any department of their choice. The team placed second would receive a cash prize of Rs 50,000/- while the other two national finalists would receive a cash prize of Rs 25,000/-. The regional and zonal finalists shall be awarded a cash prize of Rs 10,000/- and Rs 15,000/- respectively. The last date of submission is 5th December, 2017.

Head over to this link to register: http://tinyurl.com/RBI-PC...

A Centre of Excellence on Advanced Technologies was launched at IIT Kharagpur in the presence of Union Minister for Heavy Industries and Public Enterprises, Mr. Babul Suprio.

Extensive experience in Industrial Research and Incubation for IIT Kharagpur made it the best choice to lead this initiative. The Center will serve as a platform for leading industrial houses in India to come together to form a consortium and jointly support an academic centre for Advanced Manufacturing Technologies.

"It is unique for leading industrial houses in India to come together to form a consortium and jointly support an academic centre for Advanced Manufacturing Technologies. We chose the consortium model for industrial partnership because the need for the infusion of next-gen technology in the manufacturing sector transcends domestic competition and needs the concerted cooperation of all industrial houses in this sector. The consortium will also enable self-sustainability of the centre beyond the period of DHI support," said Pallab Dasgupta, Dean Sponsored Research, IIT Kharagpur.

The likes of Tata Sons, Tata Motors, Tata Steel, TCS, Ramkrishna Forgings, Heavy Engineering Corporation, Bharat Heavy Electricals Limited and Ampere Vehicles are onboard in this consortium.
Source- http://www.millenniumpost...

story: The Scholars' Avenue added 5 new photos — with Ankit Meena and 14 others.
message:
Photography is an art where creativity and the depths of thought are challenged to dig deeper into the perspectives, which speak louder than words.

We all carry thousands of photos in our pockets itself. Amidst this scenario, Professor Abraham George of the Department of Architecture & Regional Planning - IIT Kharagpur, supervised the exhibition of Photography, Art and Visual communication at the Atrium of the department.

The exhibition started at 4 P.M. on 9th November(Thursday) and the Atrium was visited by the Deputy Director of the institute, Prof. Sriman.K. Bhattacharyya.

The work put up, has been done by the second year undergraduate students of the department which will be available for display till November 10 (Friday) for everyone.

The Scholars' Avenue appreciates the efforts of the students and encourages the fellow students to have a look at the exhibition!

We had some words with Dimple Kapadia (Girls' Captain, Inter IIT Athletics team) and Vice Captain Deepashree Dutta regarding the state of participation of girls for Inter IIT Sports. They rued the lack of girls' participation in enough numbers to the extent that they don't even have the complete and stable team for some of the events! Most of the students look for immediate results and recognition, expecting themselves to see in the Inter IIT team in just one year of practising which is not so likely. Hence, they tend to stop coming for the practice. Go through the video to know more about their views:
