story: Sourav Das added a new photo to Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur's Timeline.

message:
When nostalgia bit our alumni to the core, when the past met the present, where old memories were relived and old friendships were renewed: The 14th Annual Alumni Meet gave us everything. From mighty musical nights to cheerful hall visits, the last AAM was a 3 day long bliss for the campus and the alumni together.

This throwback video spans the entire 14th Annual Alumni Meet and we'd like to heartily thank the batches of '67, '77 and '92, who attended this meet.
We also take up the occasion to invite the guests of honour for the 15th AAM, the Golden jubilee batch of 1968, the Ruby jubilee batch of 1978 and the Silver jubilee batch of 1993.

The wheels have been set into motion for the 15th Annual Alumni Meet! :D

For the first time, Technology Students Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur is conducting OPEN IIT TIME LAPSE COMPETITION.

1. Time should not be more than 7 mins . More than this time leads to deduction of 10% of total marks.
2. No. of person should not be more than 5.
3. Drive Link of video should be sent on given email id.
4. No changes should be made after submission.
5. Background music can be used.

Interested students can send their submissions at tsg.socult@gmail.com.
Last date of submission: 23rd October.

Prof. Soumya K Ghosh, Department of Computer Sc & Engineering IIT Kharagpur has been awarded National Geospatial Chair Professorship of the Department of Science and Technology, Government of India.

Prof. Soumya K Ghosh completed his PhD from IIT Kharagpur in 2002 and joined the institute as an assistant professor in 2003. He led a Spatial Informatics Group where they work on Geographic Information System, Spatial Prediction, Human Movement, etc. They also work for developing prototype for Spatial Data Infrastructure, Mobile GIS, etc.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur heartily congratulates our professor and wishes him all the best for future endeavours!

The Union Cabinet today cleared revised pay scales for nearly eight lakh teachers and academic staff of higher education institutions following the implementation of the Seventh Pay Commission. The approved pay scales would be applicable from January 1, 2016. The revised pay package will cover teachers of 119 centrally funded technical institutions like IITs, IISc, IIMs, IISERs, IIITs, and NITIE.

This decision will benefit 7.58 lakh teachers and equivalent academic staff in the 106 universities and colleges which are funded by the UGC and the union HRD ministry and also 329 universities which are funded by state governments and 12,912 government and private aided colleges affiliated to state public universities.
Source- http://economictimes.indi...

"Know Your Alumni"-E3:
Students' Alumni Cell presents its new series 'Know Your Alumni' where it will bring up interviews, blogs and posts about the extraordinary alumni of IIT Kharagpur to you.
In E-3, we have Anuradha Acharya and Subhash Lingareddy, founders of Ocimum Bio Solutions and Mapmygenome.
Anuradha Acharya is the founder and was the CEO of Ocimum Bio Solutions, a genomics outsourcing company for discovery, development and diagnostics, headquartered in Hyderabad, India from 2000 to 2013. She was awarded Young Global Leader by the World Economic Forum in 2011.
Subhash Lingareddy is presently the President and CFO of Ocimum Biosolutions and also Founder at Mapmygenome.in. he received Beta Gamma Sigma Honor Society Award in 1996.
They talk about various ventures in their career and about the differences in US and Indian education....

Happay, the new age business expense management solution provider started in 2012 by IIT-KGP graduates Varun Rathi and Anshul Rai, has announced clocking over one million transactions through the platform, with an astounding annual growth rate of 200 percent.

Currently, over 4000 businesses in India are managed through the Happay platform naming Aditya Birla Retail Ltd., Health & Glow, IBIBO Group, Uber, Urban Ladder, OYO Rooms, V Guard, and Unnati NGO. With an overall employee base of 250 across ten cities in India, Happay plans to double its employee strength and also onboard 10,000 enterprises by 2019.

Are you stressed about the mid semester exams that did not go well? Or about someone who ridiculed you for being fat? Are you really bogged down by the problems of your daily life? Even if you are not, there are people around you who actually are.

In our humble bid to give voice to those who prefer to keep quiet, we launch our Social Cause for Spring Fest, IIT Kharagpur 2018, 'Umang' on the occasion of World Mental Health Day.

You can join us in our cause for mental health and show support by adding our ‘Umang’ frame to your profile picture. You can send us your experiences and suggestions at https://2018.social.sprin... .

Come let us not ignore this stigma anymore but stand up to it and join our hands in this campaign for creating a beautiful world with beautiful minds!

#StandUpToStigma #Umang #SpringFest2018

Design Credits: Richik Raha
Videography: Parag Mhaiske, Pranay Narayankar, Akshay Choudhary

In the first decision of its own kind, IIT-Kanpur senate suspended 22 second-year B.Tech students, yesterday, as a punishment after junior students filed a complaint to the Dean of Student Affairs against seniors, saying they were thrashed, abused, and forced to do inhuman acts. The probe committee had found the charges to be true, and recommended the suspension of all 22 students.
"Sixteen students have been suspended for three years and six others for one year,” said Mr. Manindra Agarwal, Deputy Director of IIT Kanpur. In addition, the president and other office bearers of the student gymkhana were removed from their respective posts allegedly for ignoring the complaints as per the reports by Hindustan Times. The suspended students would not have the right to go for a mercy appeal during the suspension period.

Source: http://www.hindustantimes...

The Indian Institutes of Technology seem on the verge of witnessing a protest very soon. This time not by the students but by the faculty members! Yes, Teachers at the Indian Institutes of Technology are set to hold a protest for the first time against the NDA government over its delay in announcing a revised pay package although an expert panel had recommended a revision nearly six months back.

The All India IIT Faculty Federation, which represents nearly 4,000 members, has given the call for the token protest. The last time IIT teachers had protested over pay scales was in 2010 when the UPA was in power. The AIIITFF has written to all the faculty forums at every IIT to hold the protest on Tuesday for an hour from around 5.30pm after working hours. In its communication to the faculty forums, the federation is learnt to have said that the implementation of the seventh pay commission was getting delayed and colleagues across the country were genuinely concerned.
Source: https://www.telegraphindi...

message:
A workshop-cum-cultural programme on ‘Stress Management’ through ‘Sahaja Yoga Meditation’ was organised on Saturday evening at TOAT, IIT Kharagpur by Sahaja Yoga Organisation. The Guest of Honour, Professor Somesh Kumar, Dean (SA) and the Convener, Mr Anirudha Saha (Judge, Jhargram) inaugurated the programme by lightening the lamp. Professor Somesh Kumar introduced the need of Sahaja Yoga Meditation especially for the students to achieve the true excellence in their lives.

“We talk about ‘Atmavishwas’- the self-confidence and ‘Atmasamman’- the self-respect but do we ever think about ‘Atma’ itself?”, with these words, Mr Anirudha Saha underlined the human’s association with the pervading energy in the universe and advocated the regular practice of Sahaja Yoga for the Human Resource Development as well as Management.
Mr Anurag Kushwaha who presently works at DRDO, New Delhi and has been practising Sahaja Yoga Meditation for 15 years, delivered a presentation discussing on how we can achieve the thoughtless awareness through ‘Sahaja Yoga’ leading towards the eternal happiness. He also discussed the science of this method which serves to get back the control over the dormant energy (Kundalini) that resides within ourselves.

The workshop also comprised of cultural performances conveying the art as an indispensable part of Yoga. Mr. Deepak Sharma, a Kathak dancer from the prestigious Lucknow Gharana and his daughter Aarshi Sharma presented stellar dance performances followed by a Rajasthani folk dance staged by Sarita Srivastava. Mr. Deepak Verma, a renowned singer, chanted Bhajans with Mr. Pradyut Kumar Pal playing the Tabla and both creating a delightful environment in the amphitheatre.

Sahaja Yoga Organisation is to arrange for another workshop on Sahaja Yoga Meditation at TOAT, on Sunday at 5pm. Besides, similar sessions for meditation are to be held at Technology Staff Club every Sunday at 10am. We urge the student community to actively take part in such workshops so that the efforts of the institution get repaid in the form of healthy lives of its students.
Those who are interested in Sahaja Yoga Meditation can find more information about the same, here: http://www.sahajayoga.org... /

Prof. Siddhartha Das, Professor at the Department of Metallurgical & Materials Engineering has been selected for the "IIM - Distinguished Educator Award" by the Indian Institute of Metals. He will receive the award during the 55th National Metallurgists' Day celebration on 14th November 2017.

The IIM is over 60 years old premier professional Metallurgical Institute set up to promote and advance the study and practice of the Science and the art of making and treating of metals and alloys and to promote just an honourable practice in Metallurgical profession.

Prof. Das completed his Ph.D. from the University of Illinois, USA and joined the institute in 1997. He has also been a recipient of 2015 Extraction and Processing Division Technology Award, TMS, Warrendale, USA and is life member of many professional bodies which include Indian Institute of Metals, Materials Research Society of India, Powder Metallurgy Association of India, Tau Beta Pi, a national engineering honour society, USA and Sigma Xi, a national scientific research society, USA.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur heartily congratulates our professor and wishes him all the best for future endeavours!

Indeed a long journey! Sometimes shaky, sometimes steady. But a journey worth documenting!
From earning accolades like “The Nerve of KGP”, “The Voice of KGP”, and many more to always striving to deliver on the expectations in the best way possible, Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur has come a long way, thanks to the unsung efforts of the league of Awaaz ex-chief editors and ex-editors and the current team members as well. This video recognises their efforts, albeit not all, as all those efforts along with the emotions and the craving for the betterment of KGP community is not too easy to depict. Watch out for how Awaaz has made impact in the campus; be it keeping KGP well-informed, or covering issues which need immediate attention from the administration as well (Security issue, Fee hike issue, Issue of cumbersome CV module last year), or running campaigns (Save Electricity Campaign, Clean KGP Campaign), or active reporting on passport bribery issue in the passport office resulting in immediate halt to such malpractices, and many more.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur has always been and will always remain committed to its objective of the betterment of KGP community and sticking to the core values of Constructive journalism. Thank you KGP for all the love and support!

मीडिया' को लोकतंत्र का चौथा स्तम्भ माना जाता रहा है, और माना भी क्यों न जाए? जब सवाल नहीं पूछे जाएँगे तो फिर बिगड़ते काम काज को सुधारने की आवाज़ कौन उठाएगा या जब चीज़ें सही हो रही होंगी तो उसकी प्रशंसा कर उसे लोगो तक कौन पहुँचाएगा?

कहते हैं विचारों को आप मार नहीं सकते; सही ही है| साथ ही जब तक मीडिया और पत्रकारिता का अस्तित्व बचा रहेगा तब तक ये विचार द्रुत गति से फैलते रहेंगे | आज हम ऐसे समय में जी रहे हैं जब वैचारिक असहिष्णुता आम हो गयी है और ऐसे में ज़रूरत होती है एक जागरूक, बेचैन और साहसी तबके की जो हर किस्म की नाइंसाफियों पर बेबाकी से बोले और समाज के हित में पहलुओं का विश्लेषण करे |

आज से दस वर्ष पूर्व खड़गपुर में जब ऐसे तबके की ज़रूरत महसूस हुई तब स्थापना की गयी उत्साह से लबरेज एक टीम की - 'आवाज़', जिसका उद्देश्य था कि वह कैंपस के जन जन की आवाज़ बन जाए | पत्रकारिता में विचारों की जंग होती ही रहती है; पत्रकार का काम ही है कि वो हर पहलू को दिखाए, और इन दस सालों में न जाने हमने कितने महत्त्वपूर्ण पड़ावों को पार किया, न जाने कितनी मुश्किलें झेलीं और आलोचनाएं तो समय समय पर लगी ही रहती हैं |

खैर, आलोचनाएं इस बात का प्रतीक हैं कि हमें ग़म्भीरता से लिया तो जा रहा है, और इनसे प्रेरित होकर हम लगे रहे, और इतिहास इस बात का साक्षी रहा है कि हमने सूरत को बदलने की कोई कसर न छोड़ी | साल दर साल बीतते गए, पर अपने KGP जनता के हित में हमने हरसम्भव मदद करने की कोशिश की | GC से लेकर प्लेसमेंट्स तक- हर खबर का हर पहलू आप तक पहुँचाया गया |

हम वैसे समय में हैं जहाँ पत्रकारिता में हाथ घुमाकर अपनी ही पीठ थपथपाने का प्रचलन बढ़ गया है क्योंकि जनमानस का उत्साहवर्धन क्षीण पड़ता जा रहा है, और हमें गर्व है हमारी टीम पर, टीम के भूतपूर्व सदस्यों पर, टीम को सतत मार्गदर्शन देने वाले शिक्षकों पर और सबसे बढ़कर आप पर, क्योंकि आप ही से तो हमारा वजूद है | हम सभी एक बार पुनः आप सभी जनों का आभार प्रकट करते हैं और आशा करते हैं कि आगे भी यह सहयोग बना रहेगा |

A “Stress Management programme” is being organized by SAHAJA YOGA MEDITATION. It is scheduled to be held on 7th October (today) from 5:00 pm - 8:00 pm at Tagore Open Air Theatre.
Admission to this programme is open to all. This activity can help all of us to alleviate stress-related problems and illness including depression. It makes one achieve a better work-life balance and establishes peace, joy and satisfaction. Please make the best use of this opportunity.
The schedule for this programme is as follows:
5:00 – 5:05 pm - Welcome of Chief Guest & all new seekers by Convenor.
5:05 – 5:20 pm - Candle lighting by Chief Guest Prof. S.K.Bhattacharya, Deputy Director & Guest of Honour Prof. Somesh Kumar, Dean Students affairs, IIT Kharagpur.
5:20 – 5:25 pm – Introduction about programme & Sahaja Yoga by Mr. Anurag
Kushwaha (DRDO).
5:25 – 5:45 pm – Cultural Programme (classical dance & Devotional Songs).
5:45 – 6:35 pm – Stress Management workshop through meditation.
6:35 – 7:40 pm – Cultural Programme (Devotional Songs & classical Dances).
7:40 – 7:45 pm – Questions and answers session.
7:45 – 8:00 pm – Concluding speech & vote of thanks by Secretary.
All the students are requested to attend this programme.

Have you ever wondered how a global investment bank like Goldman Sachs uses the knowledge and skill of smart people like you to drive some of the most cutting edge innovations in the field of finance?

We bring to you GS Quantify 2017, an exciting computer science, quant and machine learning contest, where you will be tested on real-world problems from different areas of quantitative finance and analytics. The problems are hand-picked by us to give you a flavor of what we do every day, and demand an understanding and application of topics like optimization, linear algebra, stochastic calculus, data mining, algorithms, data structures and many more.

Join us for GS Quantify and compete against the best minds across the best engineering and science schools and stand a chance to win exciting prizes like iPhones, iPads, etc. Top teams get an all-expense paid trip to the Goldman Sachs Bengaluru office to present their solutions.

To read more about the previous edition of GS Quantify, please visit our Blog on GS Quantify 2016 Blogpost.

Eligibility Criteria:
- Open to students of all years
- Maximum of 3 participants per team

Hey, 1st and 2nd years!

Technology Robotix Society conducts an IEEE certified Winter Workshop every year for 1st and 2nd years interested in learning more advanced concepts of robotics, namely Autonomous Robotics and Image Processing. The workshop is conducted in two phases, the first one is for students who aren't attending EAA camps in the first week of December and the second one is for those who are.

Attendance in KRAIG classes is not compulsory to attend the Winter Workshop but is recommended.

We are releasing the tentative dates of the workshop so that the interested students may book their tickets in advance.

Phase 1: 1st December to 7th December
Phase 2: 9th December to 15th December

Do you know that a KGPian is one of the project team members of the MIT Hyperloop team who won the SpaceX Hyperloop Pod Competition Design phase held in January 2016 and member of its Electrical sub-team which integrates the electrical subsystem into the pod? And currently, he is working in the Low Voltage Electronics Integration team of Tesla! He graduated in Mechanical Engineering from IIT Kharagpur (2010-14) with a staggering CGPA of 9.63 which fetched him the “President of India Gold Medal” for the highest CGPA among the graduating batch. Not only that, he also received “Dr. B.C. Roy Memorial Gold Medal” for being the best all-rounder student in the graduating batch. He went on to pursue his Master's Degree from MIT (GPA of 5/5) and worked as a Research Assistant at the Sloan Automotive Laboratory, MIT.
This genius is none other than Mr. Lakshya Jain who has made us all proud with his accomplishments at world stage! And it was just a matter of time before he was going to feature in our column "Jewels of KGP".
Mr. Lakshya talks about his school days, passion for mechanical engineering, interest in automobiles, internship experiences, extra-curricular activities, education at MIT, work at Hyperloop, time management, hobbies, advice etc. Give this article a read.
http://awaaziitkgp.org/la...

Prof. Sudip Misra, Associate Professor at the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, IIT Kharagpur has been elected as a fellow of the National Academy of Sciences, India (NASI) for the year 2017. He completed his Ph.D. from Carlton University, Canada and joined the institute in 2007.

Prof. Misra has already been recipient of several prestigious awards and honours which include Samsung Innovation Award (2014), Young Systems Scientist Award, Systems Society of India (SSI) (2010), Alexander von Humboldt Fellowship (Germany) (2010), The National Academy of Sciences, India – Swarna Jayanti Puraskar (2008) and many more.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur heartily congratulates him for this feat and wishes him all the best for future endeavours!

Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur is organizing a Workshop on Entrepreneurship Promotion. Professor Larry Cox of Pepperdine University ( USA ) will conduct this workshop.

It is a two-day workshop with timings as below:

9th of October: 6 pm - 8.30 pm
10th of October: 6 pm - 7.30 pm

The components of the workshop include Increasing Creative Capacity and Creative Problem Solving Process. Professor Larry Cox has expressed interest in sponsoring the travel to USA for few students of IIT Kharagpur in connection with Product and Entrepreneurship Promotion based on certain criteria that would be decided after these interactions.

Please fill out this form ( http://tinyurl.com/ecell-... ) by 10 am on 7th October 2017. Selected people will be intimated by email by 7th October 2017 itself.

Students will get participating certificate and are all invited for the high tea at the closing on each day. Please note that the attendance is compulsory for both(9th and 10th October 2017) days.

Prof. Suman Chakraborty, Professor at the Department of Mechanical Engineering, also serving as the Head of School of Medical Science and Technology (SMST) and Associate Dean at Sponsored Research and Industrial Consultancy (SRIC), IIT Kharagpur has been elected as Fellow of the American Physical Society (APS), a unique recognition in this field.
He joined the institute in 2002. He already has many awards and honours to his name including the highest scientific honour from the Government of India i.e., Shanti Swaroop Bhatnagar Prize (2013) and Scopus Young Scientist Award (2008). His research area includes Microfluidics and Nanofluidics, Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) etc. He has been the pioneer to agglomerate the science of microscale fluid mechanics with the complex biophysics of cells. He has also been the first researcher to develop a fundamental theory on the electrokinetic transport of blood through microfluidic conduits. He has about 340 research papers to his name, accepted by reputed journals
Earlier this year, in April, we had a talk with Prof. Chakaraborty where he had discussed his journey, engineering, Ph.D., hobbies etc. Give it a read here: http://awaaziitkgp.org/su...
.
American Physical Society (APS) is the world's second largest organization of physicists. The Society publishes more than a dozen scientific journals, including the prestigious Physical Review and Physical Review Letters, and organizes more than twenty science meetings each year.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates him for this feat and wishes all the best for future endeavours!

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur is with Soham Chandorkar and 8 others.
message:
What do you see in this picture? KGP Water Polo team collecting their Runners-up trophy and medals in the recently concluded Inter IIT Aquatics Meet. Right? But it's more than what meets the eyes! They were collecting it with heavy hearts, with a bit gloomy emotions all around, bit dejected and feeling not-so-good about not being able to win the final. But what did actually happen?
They outplayed IIT Guwahati by 11-0, beat the favourites i.e., host IIT Madras by 5-4 and drew valiantly with IIT Bombay by 4-4. In semifinal, they made a mockery of it by winning it with a score of 10-2.
In finals, they were lagging behind with a score of 2-3. And not to forget, they were two times defending champions! Chips were down. The chances of winning the gold again looked bleak. But that's exactly when they bounced back in style to make a stunning comeback and levelled the score! It went down to penalties. They were still in the game and did a brilliant job by holding the opposition on tie, given that opposition had one of the best goalkeepers of the tournament. It then went down to 'sudden death' and they lost it by just a whisker!
Does the story end here? No, certainly not! They gave it their everything, every ounce of energy that their body had, every drop of sweat that they could have offered and showcased indomitable will, grit, determination and strength! It was the culmination of hours long practice sessions and rigorous training schedules.
And it's not only the Water Polo team, it has been the same with all other members of our contingent. They all have tried their best and left no stones unturned in bringing laurels to KGP. Be it silver or bronze or even no medal, it's not the medals for which they deserve applause, it's their sincere efforts that deserves tonnes of pats on their backs!
Let's take a moment and appreciate what they have achieved and accomplished. Let's applaud their collective efforts irrespective of what's the colour of the medal.
We all KGPians are indeed proud of you all, team KGP! Well done!

The 33rd Inter-IIT Aquatics Meet, four days of aquatics extravaganza, conducted by IIT Madras, witnessed an enthralling performance by the participants. Here are the final results and summary of this meet.

The Final Standings are as follows:

Swimming: Men’s
1. IIT Madras (11 Gold, 3 Silver, 5 Bronze) - 84 pts
2. IIT Bombay (2 Gold, 2 Silver, 4 Bronze) - 29 pts
3. IIT Kanpur (0 Gold, 3 Silver, 3 Bronze) - 26 pts
4. IIT Delhi (3 Gold, 1 Silver, 1 Bronze) - 25 pts
5. IIT Kharagpur (0 Gold, 5 Silver, 2 Bronze) - 25 pts

Swimming: Women's
1. IIT Madras (3 Gold, 3 Silver, 1 Bronze) - 28 pts
2. IIT Bombay (2 Gold, 2 Silver, 2 Bronze) - 24 pts
3. IIT Kanpur (1 Gold, 1 Silver, 0 Bronze) - 8 pts
4. IIT Kharagpur ( 0 Gold, 0 Silver, 2 Bronze) - 8 pts
5. IIT Roorkee ( 0 Gold, 0 Silver, 1 Bronze) - 5 pts

Water Polo:
Gold - IIT Kanpur
Silver - IIT Kharagpur
Bronze - IIT Madras

Top four finishers in Swimming from IIT Kharagpur:
Men’s
Kryalos Indresh: 100m Breaststroke (Silver), 200m Breaststroke (Silver), 50m Breaststroke (Silver)
Gitanshu Bhatia: 200m Backstroke(Bronze), 50m Backstroke (Bronze)
Shubham Pandey: 100m Freestyle (Silver), 50m Freestyle (4th position)
Pushpak Roy: 100m Backstroke (4th position), 50m Breaststroke (4th Position)
4 x 100m Medley Relay: Gitanshu Bhatia, Kryalos Indresh, Pushpak Roy, Shubham Pandey (Team Silver)

Women’s
Women’s 4x50m Freestyle Relay: Prutha Kale, Oindrila Saha, Barsa Majumder, Nastassja Rai (Bronze)
Prutha Kale: 50m Butterfly (Bronze), 50m Freestyle (4th position)
Oindrila Saha: 50m Butterfly (4th position)

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur heartily congratulates all the winners and gives a huge round of applause to all the participants who gave it all and left no stone unturned in bringing laurels to IIT Kharagpur.

Professor Samit Kumar Ray, Professor at the Department of Physics, IIT Kharagpur has been elected fellow of the National Academy of Sciences, India (NASI) for the year 2017. He is also serving as the current Director of S.N. Bose National Centre for Basic Sciences, Kolkata.
Prof. S.K. Ray joined the institute in 1991. He already has several awards and honours in his kitty including MRSI-ICSC Superconductivity & Materials Science Annual Prize (2015) and INSA Young Scientist Award (1993). He is also a member of IEEE, USA.
The National Academy of Sciences, India was founded in the year 1930, with the objectives to provide a national forum for the publication of research work carried out by Indian scientists and to provide opportunities for exchange of views among them. The Academy undertakes several “science-society” programs under the guidance of its Presidents and Fellows.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates him and wishes all the best for future endeavours!

story: The Scholars' Avenue added 2 new photos.
message:
The 33rd Inter IIT Aquatics Meet ‘17 being held at IIT Madras was flagged off yesterday with a speech by Chief Guest Mr.Rehan Poncha, a five-time national champion and Arjuna Award winner, along with a diving performance and an act by Mr.Preveen Pandita, an illusionist.

With Day 2 almost coming to a close, KGP is giving its all to bring home the coveted cup. While the Water-Polo team is going strong with two wins, the Swimming team is having a tough time facing the stiff competition. Our current medal tally consists of a silver and bronze, bagged by the men’s and women’s contingents respectively. The finals of todays events are currently underway.

We’d like to throw some light on the general structure of the tournament. We have posted below a day wise consolidated list of the events in both the categorized events – Swimming and Water Polo.
The swimming events kick off early in the morning every day, with trials/heats held in the first half to screen the teams, out of which the top 8 contenders qualify for the finals of the respective events, which would be held in the later half of the day. This will continue for all the 4 days.
While on the other side, 4 Water Polo matches are held everyday – with each of the eight teams facing one opponent from their respective pools. The 4th day will witness the winners of each pool face the runners-up of the other pool respectively for the semifinal matches, the losers of these semis will fight for the 3rd place and the most awaited finals will be held thereafter.

We wish our KGP contingent the very best for the rest of the tournament and hope to see them shine brightly in every one of the events.

Stay tuned for more updates on the standings and results!

message: Inter IIT Sports Meet presents the first edition of the 'Back with a Splash', the daily newsletter for the 33rd Inter IIT Aquatics Meet, 2017. The newsletter offers the readers The Story so far, Day 0 highlights, Know Your Teams, Today's Event Schedule and much more.

The Inter IIT Sports Meet 2017, was inaugurated in a dazzling open ceremony at IIT Madras, with the 33rd Inter IIT Aquatics being the first event for the meet. Arjuna Awardee, 3 times national champion, distinguished Olympian and swimmer Mr. Rehan Poncha was the chief guest for the opening ceremony. He shared his vast experience in sports and encouraged the athletes for their active participation in the sports.
The Inter IIT Aquatics Meet that will span over 4 days comprises of 18 events. Over 200 participants from 11 IITs are participating in the mega event. Apart from the heats of some events, IIT Madras will witness the finals of 100m backstroke, 200m breaststroke, and 400m freestyle events for men and 50m backstroke and 50m breaststroke events for women today. In addition, IIT Kharagpur will face IIT Guwahati in a much-anticipated Waterpolo encounter at 12:00pm.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes the athletes all the best.

The Saudi Royal family has ruled a decision that may change the lives of millions of women in Saudi Arabia. The decision to let women drive is being praised by human rights activists and industries alike. It is not only a step towards equality for women in Saudi Arabia but also an opportunity for the automotive industry to explore more customers. However, as positive as it may seem, a decision helping thousands of women may hurt giant service providers like Uber. Read on to find out more.

A big decision coming from the Saudi Royal family is definitely a life changing one for millions of women of Saudi Arabia. Hailing it a big success, the human rights activists think that it will make the women of Saudi Arabia more independent. On the other hand, the decision is being seen as an opportunity for the automotive industry. The decision has opened customers counting to almost half the population of the Gulf nation. Now that women can drive, the decision appears to be a threat for the cab hailing services like Uber which also suffered a major setback by its license suspension in London. Read on to find out the impact of the decision in the automotive industry in the country.

|| Foreign Training Guide ||

Foreign Training (FT) is one of the most sought after opportunities for the students, especially those who are interested in pursuing research. Along with providing great research opportunities to the students, a Foreign Training Internship also helps them in inculcating leadership qualities and give an experience about new places and cultures.
By this time, students tend to start working on how to get an FT. However, many students are not well informed about how to begin with the process.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur presents to you all the basic guide on how to apply for Foreign Training and we hope that it will prove to be quite insightful as it has been for the previous batches.
This article provides the students an insight into the entire process of applying for Foreign Internship, either through Research Programs or through the regular process of mailing the professors in an efficient and streamlined manner.
We would also like to point out that one should not blindly go for an FT under the impression of just getting a good point to add to his/her resume. Students should also look into the research projects and similar opportunities at our own institute and get involved in them as well.
http://awaaziitkgp.org/ft...

story: Team KART-Formula SAE team of IIT-Kharagpur added 2 new photos.
message:
Engineers are not superhuman. They make mistakes in their assumptions, in their calculations, in their conclusions. That they make mistakes is forgivable; that they catch them is imperative. Thus it is the essence of modern engineering not only to be able to check one's work but also to have one's work checked and to be able to check the work of others.
~Henry Petroski
#sanitychecks #becauseracecar #modernengineering

Three alumni from IIT Kharagpur - Mainak Sarkar (Electrical), Pritam Khan and Sumit Agarwal (both Computer Science) along with fourth co-founder Abhijit Ghosh (Civil Engineering, IIEST Shibpur) have developed a social network-cum-utility platform for food lovers where they can connect with other fellow foodies and also their favourite eateries named 'Eatable'.
On this platform, users can connect with fellow foodies and share their experiences, recommend their favourite eating places to their friends and followers, and help add a place to the network’s database. It also allows eateries (restaurants, cafes, bars, pubs and others) from any location with internet access to join the platform and connect with their customers and keep them engaged and updated about all their activities in real time.

The administration is in the process of revamping the existing curriculum and offering its students a potentially state-of-the-art type of curriculum. The recently held Senate has decided to invite views from all the stakeholders in order to accommodate all possible suggestions and revise the curriculum for the academic year 2018-19 and beyond accordingly. In this regard, a feedback form has been designed by the consensus of UG Senate Representative and all UG council members. The link to the form is given below and the students are requested to fill the form before the deadline of 5th October 2017.
https://goo.gl/forms/7O94...
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur appreciates this move from the administration and urges the student community to actively be a part of this feedback mechanism by ensuring that you are filling it with seriousness and dedication. First and second year students might not have an idea about some of the queries related to projects, industry exposure, etc. and they can gather the information regarding it from relevant sources. All the students are requested to devote some time, suggest even the minute details and help the administration make the revamp a successful one. The fact that such revamp is happening after almost a decade and there are minimal chances that a big revamp would occur in near future after this, so everyone should make the best use of the opportunity and help IIT Kharagpur and upcoming generation of students reap the benefits of your experiences and ideas.
It is advisable to go through the academic curriculum of some of the elite universities and suggest accordingly. We must ponder over the question that why the courses on the educational platforms like coursera, edx, etc. seem to attract so many students and why we can’t make our courses interesting enough for the students to motivate them to attend the classes. Inputs from everyone among the student community matters. Here we provide some of the links to the course structure of some of the elite universities.
https://www.stanford.edu/...
http://catalog.mit.edu/su...
https://www.si.umich.edu/...
We hope that the administration also ropes in the alumni who have studied under the present curriculum and can give insights about how those courses are helping them in current situations and how the improvements can be brought forth.

Dear UG Students,

Greetings from Dean (UGS) Office!

We are in the process of revamping the existing curriculum and in this connection recently held senate; it was decided to have views from all the stake holders about the revised curricula to be implemented from Academic Year 2018-19 which will be potentially state-of-the-art type of curriculum.

Kindly feel free to give your constructive critical inputs in the following form and be a part of this change.

The google form link is https://goo.gl/forms/7O94...

The deadline is 5th October 2017.

With the products enabled with internet connectivity facilitating our lives, their security has also become a major concern. This method binds a Wi-Fi camera with its PUF (Physically Unclonable Function)-based identity, a solution of which is inevitable to connect with the receiver PC and thus depriving an attacker of the access to the PC. The IITs have revoked a ban, which they had imposed on 30 companies, mostly start-ups, barring them from participating in their campus placements.

The decision to revoke the ban was taken unanimously on Wednesday at a meeting of the All-IIT Placement Committee (AIPC).

The AIPC had blacklisted these companies, including healthcare services provider Portea Medical, food-tech company Zomato and online seller of baby-care products Hopscotch, in August 2016, after they withdrew the job offers they had made to the students.

Source: http://www.business-stand...

story: The Scholars' Avenue shared Sudeshna Kumar's event.

message:
|| Google Code Jam ||
As you might be aware, Google is conducting Kickstart 2017 ( https://code.google.com/c... ) (formerly known as the APAC University Test), a 2Code Jam competition for university students to improve their technical skills and apply for career opportunities with Google. The next round is scheduled for September 24th.

1) Prepare with a codelab (duration ~2-3 hours)
We've prepared a small codelab (a tutorial combining explanation, working example code, and code exercise) to cover some basic algorithms which will help in the upcoming Code Jam Kickstart (CJK) rounds. Even if you do not plan to participate in the upcoming rounds, the codelab should help brush up basics for other algorithmic contests and interviews.

For the codelab, you would need an internet connection and basic programming skills in a language of your choice, and of course, a little enthusiasm and energy to get through the codelab. We recommend having facilitators (a faculty or a fellow student) who can help if needed, and pursue the codelab as a group exercise. If you're a facilitator, it would be nice to brush up some combinatorics, dynamic programming (DP) and geometry skills. The time it would take a student to finish the codelab would depend on their current understanding and skill, but to err on the safe side, be ready to put in 2-3 hours.

2) Sign-up for the Codelab by 20th Sep
Please sign-up via this form ( https://docs.google.com/f... ) and we will send you the codelab material via email. We recommend that you work on the codelab in groups so that it's both fun and you can learn from one another. And plan on having a facilitator (a faculty or a fellow student) who can help if needed.

Feedback/Questions
When we send the codelab via email, we will also send a link to a feedback form. Any concepts that are difficult or if you have questions about specific problems, please share/ask via the feedback form. We will address them as part of a livestream that we are hosting in the first week of October.

Post September 24th
We will host a Youtube livestream, in which we'll cover questions/concepts asked in the codelab exercise, discuss problems from a previous CJK round, common tips and tricks, strategies and general Q&A regarding CJK. We will share the livestream link with everyone who signs up for the codelab.
​
​Looking forward to an active participation.​
*We or similar pronouns refer to Google.

The campus has seen a grave concern over LAN and WiFi speed from the beginning of this semester and recently, a petition regarding the same on change.org has also been doing rounds. And many students have also emailed their grievances to CIC. Here's what CIC Network Support team has replied with:

Dear All,
This is in connection with the recent performance of campus network, especially the response time of internet access. We have received some emails from students of different halls regarding the slow response of internet access. Our team also started visiting all Halls to check the response time via LAN as well as wireless. Depending on the problem observed we will take care all of them individually and try to sort out at the earliest.
In view of the above, you are requested to send emails regarding the network accessibility issues, slightly in details, observed in your Hall to helpdesk@cc.iitkgp.ernet.in. It may be in any particular wing/ rooms/area or may be in LAN/Wi-Fi in some of the rooms, mentioning room nos./contact nos. etc. It will help us to identify and solve the issues in each and every hall separately.

We hope that this issue will be resolved at the earliest! Students are requested to send emails stating their concern as directed above.

story: Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur updated their cover photo.
message: The Students' Alumni Cell continuously endeavours to strengthen the relations of the alumni of this Institute and their alma mater. It has been instrumental in organising the Annual Alumni Meet, Regional Student Alumni Meet, regular guest lectures by distinguished alumni in the campus, publishing the annual literary magazine (Yearnings of Yore) & the annual yearbook. The Students' Alumni Cell also operates the Student - Alumni Mentorship Programme, My Imprint (Giving Back - Alumni contribution), recently launched Alumni Career Assistance Program and organises Phonathon, Alvida (the annual farewell dinner) and many more initiatives to bridge the gap between IIT Kharagpur and its esteemed alumni community.

IIT Kharagpur students have bagged myriads of PPO’s from worldwide renowned companies that include names like Goldman Sach’s, Qualcomm, Texas. It is the first time that the institute has received such an overwhelming response of around 200 international companies offering internships to its students. Students of KGP opting for Foreign Training programmes during summer recess has seemed to catalyse such a response. Their hard work and dedication have been recognized and appreciated by international companies. They are pleased to come to KGP and get hold of these dedicated, sincere souls. Do give a read of the link below to know the entire scenario of these PPO’s.

http://www.financialexpre...

Professor Amiya Mohanty, Professor at the Department of Mechanical Engineering, IIT Kharagpur has been elected as a fellow of the Indian National Academy of Engineering (INAE) with effect from 1st November 2017. He completed his Ph.D. from University of Kentucky and joined the institute in 1996. A total of 36 Indian and 5 foreign fellows have been elected this year. Presently INAE has 794 Indian and 74 foreign fellows.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur heartily congratulates him!

Just a day after we were left pondering over the decline of the Graduate Employability Ranking of IIT Kharagpur, the institute has declared in a press release that there have been more than 200 pre-placement offers from multinational companies to its students. The likes of Goldman Sachs, Samsung, Qualcomm, Texas Instruments, Adobe Systems and Wipro have offered more than 10 PPOs each. "This is an encouraging sign for us that companies recognize our students' hard work and motivation during the internship," said Prof. Debasis Deb, Professor in-charge of the Career Development Centre at IIT Kharagpur. The students have indeed boosted the reputation of the institute among the employers.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur heartily congratulates the students and wishes all final year students all the best for the placements.
Source: http://www.business-stand...

We at Students' Alumni Cell feel proud in launching our latest initiative of 'Alumni career Assistance Program (ACAP)'. This program directly aims at assisting the students sitting for placements by allotting them an alumnus placed 1-2 years back at the company that they're aiming at for placements. The allotted alumnus will act both as a mentor and a buddy and will step by step guide the student through all the confusing placement procedures and also assist in the preparation stage.

We feel that this initiative will greatly help the students at probably one of their most crucial stages in KGP and at the same time will also mark the engagement of the alumni with their alma mater right from the start!

For further queries, contact:
Utkarsh Sinha (8969169656)

We at Students' Alumni Cell feel proud in launching our latest initiative of 'Alumni career Assistance Program (ACAP)'. This program directly aims at assisting the students sitting for placements by allotting them an alumnus placed 1-2 years back at the company that they're aiming at for placements. The allotted alumnus will act both as a mentor and a buddy and will step by step guide the student through all the confusing placement procedures and also assist in the preparation stage.

We feel that this initiative will greatly help the students at probably one of their most crucial stages in KGP and at the same time will also mark the engagement of the alumni with their alma mater right from the start!

Both alumni and students are requested to follow the link and register with their details:
http://www.sac.iitkgp.ac....

For further queries, contact:
Utkarsh Sinha (8969169656)

By 2022, one-third of students across Indian Institutes of Technology (IIT) should be women and that’s the aim for the current government in its mission to empower women and rectify the gender imbalance across top science and engineering institutes across the country. Right now, women make up just about 8 % of the student population across the 23 IITs.
Department of Science and Technology is going to hold camps at the district levels to teach 50,000 senior secondary girls for IIT JEE as well as convince their parents.

Source: https://theprint.in/2017/...
https://theprint.in/2017/...

हिंदी दिवस के अवसर पर राजभाषा विभाग के द्वारा आयोजित की जा रही निबंध लेखन प्रतियोगिता और अतिथि व्याख्यान में आप सभी सादर आमंत्रित हैं।
निबंध लेखन प्रतियोगिता का विषय है - 'मेक इन इंडिया' दौर के विकासशील भारत में हिंदी का स्वरुप एवं भविष्य।
साथ ही आईआईटी खड़गपुर के भूतपूर्व छात्र एवं प्रसिद्ध जल वैज्ञानिक डॉ. दिनेश कुमार मिश्र [1968/बीटेक/सिविल] से मिलने और विचारों के आदान-प्रदान का भी अवसर प्राप्त होगा। वे अतिथि व्याख्यान में भारत की नदियों के भाषिक, सांस्कृतिक एवं वैज्ञानिक महत्व पर अपने बहुमूल्य विचार प्रस्तुत करेंगे।
दिनांक: 14 सितम्बर 2017
समय: 9:00 बजे पूर्वाह्न
स्थान: एस एन बोस ऑडिटोरियम

Aerial Robotics Kharagpur (ARK) participated in its second International Aerial Robotics Competition (IARC), in Beijing.The International Aerial Robotics Competition is the longest running collegiate aerial robotics challenge in the world. This time, team ARK performed remarkably better, grabbing the "Most Innovative Design Award" for their hexacopter named 'Falcon'.

To know more about the competition and ARK's performance read our blog-

message:
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur shared Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur's post.

As the first initiative in the student welfare portfolio, the Technology Students' Gymkhana in association with Counselling Center, IIT Kharagpur organised a 2 day workshop on Gatekeepers training which helped students gain knowledge about detection of people with problems and how they should interact with them. The event saw a participation of around 65 students representing various halls of residences and Student Welfare Group, IIT Kharagpur. The event ended with paying condolences to the colleagues we lost last year and Prof.Somesh Kumar interacted with the students and discussed about the vision to work together for a better KGP.

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 29 new photos — with Sairam Alla and 32 others.
message:
The 65th Inter Hall Athletics came to a splendid end with miraculous performances by the athletes and saw a smooth conduction throughout all three days. The closing ceremony started with medal distributions, followed by the announcement of Best Athletes and final Hall standings. And it ended with National Anthem.
The event saw the esteemed presence of dignitaries like Dean (UGS), Dean of Students' Affairs and President (TSG) who gave away the medals to athletes and lifted their spirits.
Also, some of the scenes on the ground were testimony of the sportsman spirit that we KGPians have. While dignitaries were awarding Abin, Sairam, Gaurav and many more athletes the medals, each and every member of all the hall teams gave them standing ovation in unison! It definitely speaks volumes about the sportsman spirit that we have developed over the years, given some unfortunate events that happened last semester.
We would like to thank each and every stakeholder who was involved in the smooth conduction of the meet including General Secretaries, Professor In-Charge, ground staffs, staff members from District Council of School Sports and Games (Midnapur) and all others.

story: The Scholars' Avenue added 5 new photos.
message:
Open IIT 2017 | Social and Cultural | Postering

The Open IIT Postering event was held today at S-302 from 2 PM to 5 PM.

The participants were offered three theme choices:
1. The Power of Positivity
2. Being Beautiful
3. Essence of Peace

The event witnessed a modest turnout and all the participants put their best effort in painting their thoughts and ideas on paper.

The final standings are as follows:
1. Bandana Badu [SN/IG Hall] (marks: 90/100)
2. Chaitanya Shinde [RK Hall] (marks:84/100)
3. Amlan Kumar [Nehru Hall] (marks:80/100) &
Bramha Deen [JCB Hall] (marks:80/100)

TSA congratulates all the winners!

On the occasion of World Suicide Prevention Day 2017, TLS presents to you all a beautiful hybrid composition by Yash Shukla

----
There will be days,
When you’ll feel, you possess nothing.
Deprived of love, trust, faith, hope
And all the feelings which constitute everything.
Those lonely times when
you’ll hate yourself the most,
mind will take absurd decisions
no matter how much it’ll cost.

ख्यालों के शहर में ख्वाबों की कब्र होगी,
खुशियों के रास्तों पर ग़म की गश्त होगी,
खामोश चीखों की पुरज़ोर गूंज होगी,
न जाने फिर कब लफ़्ज़ों में आवाज़ होगी।
मन शायद तुमसे बस यही सवाल पूछेगा,
क्या कभी इस रात की सुबह होगी।

But hold on, hold on for a moment.
Do you really want to die
Or again are these the external hopes
which are making your life a lie.
Because you think once you’re gone
they’ll talk fondly of you.
They’ll conclude whether it was
academic pressure or recession that killed you
or it was the black hole of competition
which finally consumed you.

पर,
उन कविताओं का क्या होगा जो तुमने लिखीं थी,
कैनवास की उस पेंटिंग का क्या होगा जो तुमने बुनी थी,
बचपन के सपनों की उस डोर का क्या होगा
जो तुम्हारी नींद से जुडी थीं,
साँसों की वो हवा भी बेकार हो जाएगी जो तुम्हारे हिस्से में लिखी थी।
वो कौन से ऐसी बात है जो जता देगी
कि तुम्हारी ज़िन्दगी जीने के लिए काबिल न थी।

Every time, this beast kills someone
in every 40th second,
imagine you’re not the only one, many are the
victims of this trend.
So when those days will make you weak,
just go to your friend and speak.

क्योंकि क्या पता ज़िन्दगी का यह मोड़
तुम्हे मौत से कुछ दिन बाद मिलवाये,
वो जो मकसद है जिसके लिए तुम आये हो
इस जहाँ में,
यह तुमको उसके और करीब ले जाए।

----
https://tlsiitkgp.org/sui...

With the declaration of 65th Interhall Athletics Meet open, a magnanimous participation was witnessed in all the events. The stadium experienced decent turnout of the crowd cheering for their Halls of Residence. Yesterday, it all started with Junior Men & Women events in 800 meters. SN Hall of Residence performed exceptionally well by bagging a total of 3 medals in Junior Women category. MS Hall, the defending champions of GC Athletics Men, left everyone speechless by securing a total of 5 medals, all the three in the senior category and gold & silver in the junior category. Manish Singh Rana (MMM Hall) managed to win the gold for his hall of residence in both 800 m and 1500 m. Lokesh Reddi and Gaurav Shenoy were among the few names who secured medals in every event they participated and left no stone unturned to contribute towards the sport. Among girls, Bharti Kushal Sharma, Dimple Kapadia, and Hima Swetha showed outstanding performances. In Men JR category, Sagar Kongari, Eslavatha Jaga Deesh, and Sumit Gaurav have shown exceptional performances by winning more than one medal for their respective halls.

MS Hall continues its legacy in GC Athletics by scoring a sum of 53 points on Day 1 and Day 2. According to the current tally of points, the competition for the second position is too fierce with the difference of just one point between RP (14 Points) and LBS (13 Points). In GC Athletics women’s category, SN Hall of Residence is leading others with 30 points. Junior events, however, with the contribution of no points in General Championship, were also quite successful with the active participation in Men’s category.

With the showcase of such fine performances, we expect the events will exhibit the same enthusiasm and sportsmanship and Day 3 will witness wonders. Here are the comprehensive results of events till now.

September 10th is World Suicide Prevention Day and to generate awareness around emotional and mental health, 'I Will' by EpsyClinic is presenting an interactive talk on "Normalizing mental health" with an objective to remove stigma regarding mental health and to share a solution with people suffering from emotional or mental health issues.
Venue: SN Bose Auditorium
Time: 12 PM
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur urges the students to come forward and attend the talk purposefully bringing those friends who show signs of depression by some means or the other and do your bit to make IIT KGP a better and happier place to live in.

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 3 new photos.
message:
Freshers turned up in optimistic numbers for a tree plantation programme conducted in the Vikram Sarabhai Residential Complex. This plantation drive was organised under the latest phase of the induction programme activities. Students, divided into groups of four, planted different species of plants with the help of gardeners.
Dean(UGS), Prof S.K.Barai, was present throughout the two-hour programme to lift the spirits of the students.
Moreover, caps which read "The spirit of KGP" were distributed to showcase the essence of the activity.

Hello KGPians,
As you know and you might have observed as well that our team has been continuously putting up sincere efforts to make the results of all the events of ongoing Inter Hall Athletics Meet available for you all. We are trying to leave no stone unturned for the same. But unfortunately, most of the posts that were made today have been removed by Facebook mentioning them as 'spam'. Hence, you might not be able to see today's results which were up on our page a few hours ago. The inconvenience caused is deeply regretted. We are trying to re-post all the results. Meanwhile, if someone can provide suggestions regarding how those posts can be brought back, kindly contact us!
Stay tuned for all the updates. We will provide today's summary in a while. These hiccups are not going to dampen our journalistic spirits! We have always been dedicated to make the news reach to you all as soon as possible and we will keep doing that!

story: The Scholars' Avenue added 4 new photos.
message:
Tree Plantation Event | Induction Program

The Institute conducted yet another event for freshers under the Induction Program. This time it was the Tree Plantation Event. A large number of trees were planted near the Vikram Sarabhai Residential Complex. Students were split into groups of four and each group was given a plant to plant. Guava, Jamrul, Chiku were a few of the types of tree saplings planted by the freshers. This event was witness to a large number of students participating with great enthusiasm. Each of the participating students received a cap at the end of the event. Also, Dean of UGS Prof. S K Barai was also spotted there greeting the students participating.

A talk before mid semester examination.

"September 10th is World Suicide Prevention Day and to generate awareness around emotional and mental health, I Will by EpsyClinic is presenting an interactive talk on "Normalizing mental health" with an objective to remove stigma around mental health and to share a solution with people suffering from emotional or mental health issues. So Join us in SN Auditorium at 12 PM and play our roles in making IIT Kharagpur a happier place."

All the students who wish to support this must be present.

Entrepreneurship is not a career option, it is a dynamic lifestyle.
Entrepreneurs put a lot of effort into their startups, and receive leaps and bounds more than they invested.
Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur brings the soul and spirit of entrepreneurship to your city, the Entrepreneurship Awareness Drive ( EAD ) 2017.
Witness great entrepreneurs of your city share their experience and knowledge, and unearth the entrepreneur in you.

story: Branding And Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur shared their post.
message:
Branding And Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur shared their post.

The Young Innovators' Program (YIP) organized for the first time by IIT Kharagpur received a fervent response from students from all over India. YIP aims at kindling the fire of innovation in students of 8th, 9th and 10th standard. The initial round saw a pan India participation of 250 teams or 600 students and 60 of them are contesting in the second round, which is synopsis submission.The teams selected for the third round will have a chance to visit IIT Kharagpur and display their idea in presence of distinguished researchers. To know in details, give a read of the link below.

http://www.millenniumpost...

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 7 new photos — at Jnan Ghosh Stadium, IIT Kharagpur.
message:
The 65th Inter Hall Athletics Meet, the first set of events of General Championship 2017-18, has been ceremonially declared open this morning by Prof. Somesh Kumar, Dean SA.The ceremony started with the hoisting of the flag followed by the march past by the athletes of all the halls participating in the meet. The march past was led by Lokeshwara Rao Reddi carrying the IIT flag. The athletes then took oath of following the sportsman spirit which was administered by Manish Datta, GSec Sports And Games,TSG. Prof. William Kumar Mohanty, President, TSG and Prof. Somesh Kumar addressed the students and applauded the enthusiasm shown by the students to promote sports in the campus.
Stay tuned to our page for the updates.

story: Saurav Singh added a new photo to Student Welfare Group (SWG)  IIT Kharagpur's Timeline.

message:
Professor Aritra Hazra, Assistant Professor of Computer Science & Engineering Department, IIT Kharagpur has been awarded the prestigious INAE Young Engineer Award 2017. He has joined the department from August 2017 and has previously served at IIT Madras.

Indian National Academy of Engineering (INAE) was established in 1987 to promote the advancement of and excellence in the field of engineering and technology and related science and disciplines and the purpose of the INAE Young Engineer Award is to recognize outstanding achievements contributions made by Young Engineers in any branch of engineering.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur heartily congratulates our professor!

Students of IIT Kharagpur to organize a PAN India Competition called “Young Innovators' Program (YIP)” on technology ideation for young innovators from school.
The competition would be conducted by Branding and Relations Cell (BARC), IIT Kharagpur for students belonging to 8th to 10th standard. It would cover major aspects such as Energy, Agriculture, Food, Environment, Hardware Modelling and Biotechnology. Teams from across various locations in India would be competing. It is supposed to harness the creativity of hundreds of bright young minds to apply their scientific knowledge to real life problems and come up with digital yet sustainable innovative solutions.The students would get a chance to explore the scientific environment within and an opportunity to present their projects in front of distinguished researchers. The program comprises of three rounds, the second round has already been started and the submissions will be accepted until 10th September. The final round is scheduled to be held at IIT Kharagpur, this year on 28th and 29th October.
For more information, visit http://www.barc.iitkgp.ac.in/yip/

Just after a slip in the QS and THE world rankings, the IITs received a huge setback when the Finance Ministry turned down the proposal of MHRD to allocate Rs 8,700 crores to enhance their global standings. The Finance Ministry was of the opinion that the premiere institutes should first address “fundamental issues” such as the autonomy to fix fees, raising resources from corporate houses and alumni members, and strengthening existing schemes.
Under Project Vishwajeet, which was cleared last year by the IIT council, the top seven IITs were supposed to use the funds (Rs 1,250 crores each over a five-year period) to upgrade their infrastructure, hire foreign faculty members, tie up with international institutions and adopt a host of other measures for improving their QS and Times global institution rankings. As no Indian Institute could make it into top 200, it certainly proved that things were not going right and there were points to ponder over!
In its note, the finance ministry also recommended that the human resource development ministry should ask IITs to construct world-class laboratories through existing grants or the recently launched Institute of Eminence scheme. Under the Institute of Eminence scheme, 10 select government institutes will be given approximately Rs 1,000 crores. "The finance ministry has suggested that the IITs should compete for that scheme instead of expecting funds through the Vishwajeet project,” an official said.
Source: http://www.hindustantimes...
http://indianexpress.com/...

The Times Higher Education (THE) rankings 2018 of the world’s top 1,000 universities in 77 countries was published yesterday and didn't pan out well for Indian institutions. Most of the Indian Institutes dropped down the ranking list as compared to previous year. Indian Institute of Science (IISc) slipped from the 201-250 band to 251-300. IIT Delhi, Kanpur and Madras came down to the 501–600 band from last year’s 401-500 rankings. IIT Kharagpur remained in 501-600 band as was the case last year.

Times Higher Education attributed this dismal showing to “drops in research influence score and research income,” and said most of the institutes “performed poorly on the internationalisation pillar.” The number of international students coming into India was limited. International scholars also were not being hired for long-term faculty positions.

“China, Hong Kong and Singapore all invest very heavily in their university systems. This year, almost all universities in the three regions improved their standing in the ranking, signalling that their commitment to investment has bolstered results year-on-year,” Phil Baty, editorial director, Global Rankings, THE, said. He said that things were likely to improve because of the “really positive news in that India’s overall research income and research quality has risen this year, and the country’s world class university plan shows that it recognises the importance of investing in higher education.”

Here. we present to you a comparison of QS Rankings and THE Rankings of 2017 as well as 2018.
Source: http://www.livemint.com/E...

Recently, the four co-founders of "Make The World Wonderful" i.e., Meghana Dabbara, Saumya Katuri, Khyathi Chodagiri and Pranita Garimella visited IIT Kharagpur and we were blessed to have such beautiful people in our campus. Their visit was followed by a guest lecture by them at Kalidas auditorium. Meanwhile, we got the privilege to talk to them and get to know their mind. They descriptively talked about their experience in KGP, their idea, journey, obstacles, and expectations.
Make the World Wonderful is an NGO, a civil society organization that aims to build harmony in society. They primarily work with children and youth, because they believe that when equipped with proper values and skills, youngers have the power to bring about positive social change.
At the core, they have a dedicated team of four young 18-year old girls, working towards fulfilling their vision of the harmonious world. Make The World Wonderful is a pilot project of iB Hubs, a Pan-India Startup Hub. With the constant support and guidance, they have formed multiple support teams, such as the Society Body, Technical Support Team, Administrative support team and so on. To know more, you can visit: http://maketheworldwonder... /

How would you feel when someone takes an initiative to make you feel happy? And what if that is taken by none other than the government? Yes, you read it right! The government is going to take an initiative to make people feel happy. The state government has come to terms with IIT Kharagpur's Rekhi Centre of Excellence for Science of Happiness for the development of Happiness Index. After taking few steps like fixing parameters of happiness index with surveys, which is to be conducted by IIT KGP in assistance with state government, the latter will start this initiative. Manohar Dubey, Chief Executive Officer of Rajya Anand Sansthan, said that the survey will start within a month. Under this initiative in Madhya Pradesh, over 115 Anand Clubs have been opened with the objective being to ensure "happiness in lives of the common man".
Source: http://timesofindia.india...

गुरुरेव परं ब्रह्म तस्मै श्रीगुरवे नमः ॥
Teachers not only teach us, but also mould us into what we will become and show us what we can do if we put our minds to it. A good teacher can inspire us to achieve our dreams and a bad one can scar us for life; a testament to the power they have over us.
On the occasion of Dr. Sarvapalli Radhakrishnan's 129th Birthday, we at The Scholars' Avenue would like to wish all the professors of IIT Kharagpur and all the teachers of India a very Happy Teacher's Day!

P.S: A senior of this commenter once said that just greetings won't do. Let's pledge to value the teachers here by not dropping classes after two weeks in the semester and then complaining. We agree that it would be a pretty nice thing to do. After all, for all the 8 AM and 5 PM classes we haven't gone to, they have been present regardless. :')

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 5 new photos.
message:
In what seemed to many a not-so-anticipated as well as surprisingly pleasant gesture, the campus was abuzz with the talks of Zakir Khan being in the campus doing the rounds yesterday! Slowly and steadily, the news broke out and KGPians were all excited to get a glimpse of the rising star of Indian Comedy i.e., Zakir Khan, popularly known as "Sakht Launda" whose heart never melts, no matter what!

In a unique and first of its own kind of initiative, Vice President (Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur) i.e., Mayank Srivastava under the tutelage of TSG had contacted Zakir Khan requesting him to pay a visit to our campus. And he accepted it gleefully. There have been incidents of many celebrities visiting the campus but this one was something that KGP has never witnessed before! You come out of your room and take a stroll towards the entrance gate only to find Zakir Khan in front of you! You rub your eyes in disbelief but finally, you realize that it's reality! Needless to say, this has been an epic experience for many.

He visited Nehru Hall of Residence and interacted with students. A lot of funny moments and light conversations followed. Students were visibly excited and pleased to the core. Zakir didn't let the moment slip and tried his hands on bat-ball making it a "moment-hai-bhai-moment-hai" moment! There were plans to visit LLR hall as well but unfortunately, he wasn't able to.
Though he was here for a short period of time, he left behind smiles on hundreds of faces and that's what was the motive behind this initiative. In last one year, our campus has seen some unfortunate events happening and this was the perfect plan to boost the dampening spirit of the people.

We would like to thank all the stakeholders who were involved in this, especially VP, TSG who put all their efforts to execute this idea. We, on the behalf of entire campus, would also like to thank Zakir Khan from the core of our hearts for taking out some time of his busy schedule and making this campus livelier with his presence.

OPEN IIT 2017-18 || DUMB CHARADES
The Open IIT Dumb Charades Competition is scheduled to be held on 7th September in F-127 from 6:30 pm onwards. The registration for the same closes at 23:59 today i.e, 5th September. Register yourself at- https://goo.gl/forms/zsET...

Zakir's Surprise Visit to the Campus!
-------------------------------------------------------------
In an unprecedented move among the recent times, our beautiful campus was blessed today with what one may call a "Happiness Visit" (term coined courtesy of a fellow KGPian). Our institute has always been the unprecedented one - even during birth and even now. But a slight tumor has started to grow, something we have recognised as a universal sin plaguing the entirety of this generation and now it's caught us in its whimsical hands. Over the past few months, our campus had the most misfortune to witness the demise of a fraction of our student community, tiny in number but gigantic in worth. It's no easy feat to recuperate from such mental fractures, but all it takes is just a little push, in the right direction, to build bridges to paradise. This is exactly what we've set in motion, if we as eyes of the campus, read right today's move.

In a secretive partnership, our VP - Mayank Srivastava along with TSG had talks with Zakir Khan, the rising face of comedy in the country, and asked him to pay a surprise visit to KGP, and Zakir accepted with much humility. He did visit before, but never like this. What we read is an initiative to make people experience the feeling of unbridled happiness, happiness that is sometimes born out of surprise, or of not knowing something. We can sure as hell imagine everyone going frantically through their Facebook Timelines not really sure whether the video of Zakir sitting there, in Nehru, in between a circle of enthused students, chatting on ignoring all the cameras about him, is true or just an elaborate prank. Incidentally Zakir is shooting a series of videos which have a similar morbid theme covered, whilst with big scoops of humanity poured into them. All you guys lucky enough to have firsthand experienced that joy, you might want to stay glued to Zakir Khan on social network sites.

It's a no brainer to connect the dots now. This moment should be remembered as one which should reinforce our firm belief in our administration, and more importantly, life again, and most importantly push us towards the end of the dark tunnel that we've gotten stuck in.

Zakir will leave by a flight tonight, pertinently unaware of the hidden blessing in what he had done, and probably and promptly laying down the road to more such wonderful surprises.

We really applaud the thinking and effort that went behind such an endeavor, mainly the VP, who seized the right moment by its throbbing vein. We would very much like to see more such meaningful and brilliant moves in the future.

"A small push in the right direction can build bridges"

#Enroute_to_being_more_Sakt

Amit Kumar Ram, Ashutosh Dwivedi, Mayank Roy (120 points)

Baibhab Pattnaik, Judhajeet Basu, Siddhant (114 points)

TSA congratulates the winners. We also congratulate the KGP quizzing contingent for their remarkable performances in recent quizzes and hope they cap it off with a strong showing in Nihilanth, the inter IIT and IIM quizzing fest.

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 16 new photos — with Vinit Kumawat and 3 others.
message: Teachers’ Day was celebrated in Netaji Auditorium today from 6 pm onwards. The event was organized by the Radha Krishnan Hall of Residence, with an appreciable attendance comprised of cultural performances by the students as well as the professors of the Institute. The students were privileged to have Professor Joy Sen on stage, playing the Sitar. Vocal performances were also delivered by Professor Seema Singh, Professor Anandrup Bhattacharya, and Professor P. Sandilya. Students presented a dance performance along with a play- 'The Third Wave' describing how an ideology strongly affects the society - be it in a positive or negative way. Some students gave solo performances as well. Also, the winners of the sketching competition held in the morning were awarded. The event came to an end with an address by the warden of the RK Hall. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur looks forward to having such successful events in future too.

The institute has officially relaxed the ban on conducting trials in halls of residence for the purpose of participation in various Open IIT and inter-hall events. The message was conveyed via an email from the Dean of Student Affairs, Prof. Somesh Kumar and has instructed that decorum may be maintained through the length of sessions. The move follows an apparent state of complete lack of communication between seniors and juniors in halls following the original ban. The message also encouraged students to participate in events like Illumination and Rangoli. The hall council members are required to document the activities and present it to VP/warden/asst. warden.

Continuing the tradition, Radhakrishnan Hall of Residence is celebrating the Teacher’s Day today at 6:00 pm in Netaji Auditorium. The event is being held today owing to an absence of holiday on 5th September. Last year, the function experienced very little attendance. Considering that it is an event held in the campus to show gratitude, respect, and admiration to our professors, we fervently urge the student community to mark their presence with all the enthusiasm and earnestly request all the professors and staff to kindly attend the function, bless the students and applaud the effort they put in organizing such an event.

Researchers from the Department of Electronics and Electrical Communications, IIT Kharagpur have developed a visual technology that enables safer driving during rains. The technology removes from real-time video the obscuring effects of rain and displays it on the windscreen of vehicles to increase the clarity of driver’s view. Thus, it aims to enhance the transportation safety by providing on-screen visualization of clear videos in typical conditions.

story: The Scholars' Avenue added 7 new photos — with Sunil Pathloth.
message:
'Manthan', a panel discussion on how we perceive India to grow in the next five years, was organised in Netaji Auditorium at 5 P.M. on September 2, 2017.The event started with an introduction to the mighty imprints that India have had in the past on the world history. The dynamics of the modern world and how we, as a nation, thrive to maintain the pace with the world was intriguing enough to involve the audience, for the next hour. The event proceeded with an introduction to the panelists and a pledge taken by everyone present there, guided by Mayank Srivastava (V.P -T.S.G), which was driven by the thought of 'New India- In the making'. The panel discussion, followed the pledge and the panelists put forth their views on varied topics.

The panel comprised of the below listed professors and students:
• Prof. Rabibrata Mukherjee- Department of Chemical Engineering
• Prof. Somesh Kumar- Department of Mathematics
• Prof. Nabanita Dutta- Department of Ocean Engineering and Naval Architecture
• Sh. Pradip Pyne- Registrar, IIT kgp
• Prof. Manas Mandal- Department of Humanities and Social Sciences
• Ayushi Mrigen- Department of Mathematics
• Sutirtha Roy- Department of Chemical Engineering
• Mayank Srivastava- V.P.(T.S.G)

Topics ranging from evolution of science, existing mind-sets in the country, women empowerment, ease in connectivity and research opportunities to the impact that the current boost in the start-up culture has had on the society were discussed. The discussion concluded with the belief that if all the resources available are synchronized and a proactive approach to the issues is taken, the India of our dreams could be built in the next five years, in accordance with the theme “New India - 2022”. The event was conducted in association with ‘Skill India’ and MHRD.

The panel discussion was followed by concerts by ETMS and Krosswindz, a band from Kolkata, 6 PM onwards. The theme of music was patriotism.

story: The Scholars' Avenue added 7 new photos.
message:
'Manthan', a panel discussion on how we perceive India to grow in the next five years, was organised in Netaji Auditorium at 5 P.M. on September 2, 2017.The event started with an introduction to the mighty imprints that India have had in the past on the world history. The dynamics of the modern world and how we, as a nation, thrive to maintain the pace with the world was intriguing enough to involve the audience, for the next hour. The event proceeded with an introduction to the panelists and a pledge taken by everyone present there, guided by Mayank Srivastava (V.P -T.S.G), which was driven by the thought of 'New India- In the making'. The panel discussion, followed the pledge and the panelists put forth their views on varied topics.

The panel comprised of the below listed professors and students:
• Prof. Rabibrata Mukherjee- Department of Chemical Engineering
• Prof. Somesh Kumar- Department of Mathematics
• Prof. Nabanita Dutta- Department of Ocean Engineering and Naval Architecture
• Sh. Pradip Pyne- Registrar, IIT kgp
• Prof. Manas Mandal- Department of Humanities and Social Sciences
• Ayushi Mrigen- Department of Mathematics
• Sutirtha Roy- Department of Chemical Engineering
• Mayank Srivastava- V.P.(T.S.G)

Topics ranging from evolution of science, existing mind-sets in the country, women empowerment, ease in connectivity and research opportunities to the impact that the current boost in the start-up culture has had on the society were discussed. The discussion concluded with the belief that if all the resources available are synchronized and a proactive approach to the issues is taken, the India of our dreams could be built in the next five years, in accordance with the theme “New India - 2022”. The event was conducted in association with ‘Skill India’ and MHRD.

The panel discussion was followed by concerts by ETMS, WTMS and Krosswindz, a band from Kolkata, 6 PM onward. The theme of music was patriotism.

A candlelight march, leading up to GolC, was organised today by the Ambedkar Bhagat Singh Study Circle. It was organised in the aftermath of the suicide of 17-year old Anitha who fought against the NEET. Several political parties and students have come out on the streets demanding the scrapping of NEET.

You can read more about the story here: http://www.deccanchronicl...

IIT-Kharagpur researchers have developed a visual technology that enables safer driving during rain.

The technology developed by researchers, led by Prof. Sudipta Mukhopadhyay, from the Department of Electronics and Electrical Communications removes from real-time video the obscuring effects of rain and displays it on the windscreen of vehicles to increase the clarity of driver's view.

It's an honour for us to meet the ex-chairman of the Nobel Prize Committee. We present you the excerpts from our discussion with Prof. Sven Lidin. It was an inspiring and engaging discussion where Prof. Lidin went to great length to describe what sets one apart, what is considered as world class research, how one can do great work and simply put: how one can get a Nobel Prize.
